author: {'steamid': '76561198049902703', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3489, 'last_played': 1587265493}
review:
This game forces you to learn certain aspects ie: exactly where to go, what you need to do unless you want to die.  You must do these things and there is no way you're going to learn all of the things you NEED to go and do in a quite specific order.  You need to look up guides and shit.  If that's your thing, then this game can be enjoyable, but that is not my thing.
  I want to be able to go to the "wrong" dungeon without being 1-shot by a slug because I didn't go to the puppy caves and eat an ant for acid resistance, or I did do that and no corpse dropped so I'm out of luck.  I like RNG, trust me, but not when you have to abide by the laws of the game and basically suck it's dick.  Also I am not a fan of certain mechanics; stealth is not like you would expect at all.  You have to spend hours learning how to smith if you want to do that.  I want to play this game without having to look up how not to die every 15 minutes.  I don't want to play easy mode, I do not mind dying but it just feels like death is such nuisance to avoid.  You better go to the wiki before you eat that corpse, because if you don't, you might lose 4 stat points and gain 1 and you don't even notice it.  And it's permanent.  And you might not agree with how it would affect your troll barbarian with 100 points in survival but it doesn't matter.  The game's rules are very hard to learn and their explanations  most likely do not exist in-game.  I want to like this game, but I don't agree with the mechanics of lots of things, therefore I do not recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036535238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5461, 'last_played': 1632540825}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030452578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 1537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1136, 'last_played': 1612861631}
review:
Great rogue-like. I appreciate that it tries to cater to both new and experienced RL players, with its allowing you to control the game via either keyboard or mouse.
I also enjoy the ability to create random characters; it forces me to play classes I usually never would, and sometimes I end up discovering that a class I never thought I'd enjoy (like the Necromancer) is actually incredibly fun.
Admittedly, while I love rogue-likes, I suck at them, and haven't gotten particularly far in this game, despite my playtime. I do feel like I'm *beginning* to get the hang of it, though. :)

Try it!

review:
WOW and WOW! One of my favourite games of all times is now in Steam. You can play in bit more modern graphical mode or the classic ASCII mode of course, what ever you prefer. I've played ADOM since the very beginning of it's ERA. Thomas Biskup and ADOM also inspired me to make my own Roguelike 20 years ago, it was called Legend of Saladir and it still can be found from the depths of the Internet, but the project was abandoned.

I definitely recommend you to support first a) Your Brain and b) Thomas Biskup and the ADOM team for their great work.

a) the brain because this game is not straightforward, you actually need to think occasionally :-)

Thank you Thomas my friend!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980861239', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1675627867}
review:
ADOM is the quintessential Roguelike. It has been constantly updated and refined for more than two decades, and it shows.

The game is hard yet rewarding, and far deeper than it seems on the surface. You will die. A lot. But with each death you will learn something that you could do differently next time, and you will have a story to tell. So, pick up your bootstraps, roll a new character, and do it again.. and again.. and again!

If you are curious what a pure "Roguelike" is, this is it: A turn-based RPG with procedurally generated dungeons and permadeath. ADOM sits alongside Nethack in this regard.

It has quite a nice graphics mode, but I recommend checking out the ASCII mode as well as it's very accessible and a great gateway to the realm of ASCII Roguelikes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030126208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3045, 'last_played': 1642571270}
review:
When I first found ADOM, it was 1998. I was still in middle school, and the era of the internet was just beginning. 

It came by way of loving Nethack, but being unable to shake the feeling that as much as I loved the style of game, there could be one with a system that fit better. In came ADOM, back during a time when the postcard quest was on the title screen.

Similar in look and feel to Nethack, ADOM features what I consider one of the most classic, purest RPG experiences.

- Deep array of mechanics
- Beautifully written monster descriptions
- Wide variety of items and objects
- Combat that benefits from thinking and planning
- Wide selection of classes, and almost uniquely, classes are NOT meant to be balanced. I can't express how much I enjoyed that the difficulty of the game itself needed not hinge on an easy/medium/hard slider, but inherent in the talents and skills of the character you brought to the world. 
- Clear main storyline goal that gives the game objective and purpose, without an overly large focus on aimless wandering (though there can be plenty of that if you choose to).

ADOM is a game that captured my imagination instantly, perhaps a side effect of the time. Graphics were miserable in the early days of PCs, and I readily found that my imagination served far better than the GPUs of the day.

These days, a graphical overlay was added with plenty of other more modern features, such as sound and mouse support.
Even with that available, I still prefer the ASCII graphics and a healthy dose of mental images.


This is the only game that I have played across more than two decades of my life, sometimes stopping for 5, 6 years at a time, but always coming back to, to enjoy again. The fundamentals of the game stand the test of time, a challenging, varied, sometimes unforgiving, old school traditional roguelike experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052853906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 101279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1662080047}

review: One of the great traditional roguelikes. I've been playing roguelikes since there was Hack but no Nethack. There's very few with the heft of narrative and content that ADOM has.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039630590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 14724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1134, 'last_played': 1662014815}
review: Веселая игра, система правил схода с D&D системой(лично мне напомнила прокачку персонажа в таких играх как Baldur's Gate и Newerwinter Nights). Играть в Rogue-like режиме интересно, смерть поджидает в самых необычных местах ) Ловушки, отравления - все это смертельно опасно. Заниматься алхимией без развитого навыка - прямой путь на кладбище.  Прочитал неизвестный свиток - броня на тебе превратилась в пепел.... Дошел до города дварфов в подземелье, зашел в магазин затариться - был съеден мимиком, притворившимся стрелами... ит.д. и т.п.  Проработаны многие мелочи жизни: к примеру нельзя одень кольца, если на руках перчатки, перчатки надо снять; свитки и оружие мокнут под дождем, ржавеют и т.д. Одним словом - игра для тех, кто любит испытания и не боится старой графики!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993451839', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 8954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6531, 'last_played': 1684308286}
review: Great game! I've been playing this since I was 13 and Adom was still new. The depth of story and gameplay more than make up for any lack of graphics and the recent improvements to the graphics and sound make the game even better than it was without losing any of the original depth. Beat it once to see the story and then see how long you can survive on hardcore. Find your favorite class or play a different one every time. The game has nearly endless variation in equipment and multiple strategies to win.

review: It's great - if you have never played any other computer game before. But, if you have played a game made this century, where you are able to change the keybindings to something that isn't insane, it really really is awkward. Get ready to be pressing five keys at once in addition to the directional keys or number keys, just to cast one spell. And you'll have to do it all again, because you failed to cast it.

review: One of those roguelikes that punishes you really hard but also rewards you accordingly. Can be a blast if you understand how to avoid "RNG" situations.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966550772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2993, 'last_played': 1629023947}
review:
This the first review I've ever made in Steam but I've been playing Adom for years and years. This game is simply the greatest adventure game you can own, however it is rock solid and totally unforgiving. You're characters will die in hilariously unpredictable ways and you won't even nearly be ready for it, from accidentally kicking an altar to putting on a new suit of armour in Dwarf-town - before you've identified it - and finding out it's Mithril chain mail of hate and having the entire town suddenly HATE you.

Reading online and watching guides is essential to not make game ending mistakes and the list of commands can be off-putting for new players but perseverance in Adom brings great rewards. Own this game, it's the deepest game you will ever play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993000360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 5226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1615421082}
review:
I am changing my review.  The previous one was written on a poor effort applied to the game and completely wrong.  
I previously wrote that the game caters only to a specific class of player.  Mainly  fighter tanks.   This judgement was off of a poor understanding of the character building.   Hopefully I've learned something more about the game.

This game has a learning curve.  Your beginning stats you choose can have a huge impact on your experience.   Hence there is an option that allow the game to pick those for you so you have an easier time.

ADOM offers a lot of options to the way you play it.  They all have their own challenges.   it is a good rogue like.  If you know what that means...try it out.  But give it 10+ hrs at a minimum.   

If you're not a "rogue like" fan...well..good luck. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197989062483', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 18356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9212, 'last_played': 1707620565}
review: This version of ADOM is a beautiful, accessible representative of the most hardcore Rogue games that harken back to the ASCII games of yore. The new UI, quality of life upgrades and options to make it (cough) easier to play than back in the 90s... (Not that I would know as I keep playing it in hardcore mode). It's HARD... it's FUN and I'm still not sure how bad it's to get corrupted. I've been playing this game for MONTHS and I still haven't made it to the titular Dungeon the game's based on. I'll play this game for years... You should too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996616983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 948, 'last_played': 1578414300}
review:
It was good 20 year ago. It's not so good today. 

The novelty of having your hard earned and crucial equipment destroyed because you tried to open a door or read a book no longer has the appeal it once did. ADOM is a relic of the past, and the graphical tiles and other quality of life features you get in this paid version are not worth the price tag. There are a dozen other roguelikes that have improved on the formula successfully, and I just can't recommend this game anymore unless you really love having your time wasted by pure RNG BS.

For the life of me, I don't now how I managed to sink a few hundred hours into this title when I was a much younger man. The various ways that ADOM can waste your time for no reason other than a dice role or hidden variable are intensely annoying and unfun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027502604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1578349594}

author: {'steamid': '76561198210883067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1374, 'last_played': 1606674238}
review: The nicest Roguelike I ever played. It has both the depth of dear-to-my-memory Nethack and more wizzes and bangs; graphics are old-fashioned but nice, interface is easy to grasp. I only scratched the surface and yet enjoyed it very much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163802560', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4262, 'last_played': 1553276083}
review:
Фундаментальная классика жанра roguelike. Прекрасная, сложная игра, потенциально способная увлечь на месяцы и годы. Теперь с симпатичной, вполне соответствующей духу игры тайловой графикой и адекватным, приятным звуковым сопровождением.
Освоиться в ADOM новичку непросто, но игра сторицей - увлекательным и глубоким геймплеем, большой вариативностью стратегий, билдов и ситуаций, своеобразной мрачной и насыщенной атмосферой - вознаграждает усилия, затраченные на её освоение. Крайне рекомендую всем любителям РПГ и рогаликов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198233258796', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5346, 'last_played': 1625072900}
review:
ADOM is unique among roguelikes in that it has more of an RPG bent (it features an extensive skill system, for instance). While dungeon levels are (for the most part) completely random, a lot of emphasis is placed on the plot, which is a big draw of the game. The plot is immersive, intelligent and interesting. You enter the Drakalor Chain with the goal of stopping the spread of Chaos, completing quests as you see fit and generally fighting for glory. To aid the plot, there are many locations in the overworld and elsewhere that are constant. Thus, depending on the decisions you make, the same NPCs reappear and the same quests are available in most games (almost no quests are required to complete the game, but they are all interesting and worthwhile!).

ADOM has a lot of depth and complexity, and offers the best replay value of any game I've ever played. I have been playing it since 2009 and have won 24 times with 13 different classes and 8 different races – and I'm far from bored or done with it! From 2002-2012, there were no new releases, but a vibrant community still played the game incessantly during that time; [i]that's[/i] replay value.

ADOM is all about flexibility and control of your character. Not only are there five different possible endings, but your trip to the end can take many different forms. You can kill all your enemies with thrown shields. You can true berserk everything to death. You can dual-wield daggers or go unarmed for the entire game. You can have a pet cave bear kill all your enemies. Want to sling gems? toss hats? kick or spit everything to death? It can all be arranged. While each class has its own specialties, the options are truly endless and offer you basically complete freedom.

Let's make no bones about it: ADOM is extremely challenging, and can be quite difficult even for a roguelike. Learning the ins and outs of the game takes a lot of time, but it's a very rewarding experience. Once you get the hang of it, you'll find that there are almost no situations that can't be overcome by taking the time to think and evaluate your options.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023026505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1575623848}
review:
In normal mode the game is just too hard and you can't save / re-load the game. So you'll probably never see 95% of the game.

In easy mode the game is fairly easy for long periods, then suddenly you die. In my case (after 10 hours of play) I was unable to complete a single quest. The poison mechanics were especially brutal at low level.

There is a cheat mode, and if you are really careful I am sure you it is possible to complete the game in cheat mode. But even in cheat mode you can die before it is possible to cheat. Could have been so much better if there was just a Quick Save function in cheat mode.

10 hours on the first quest was enough. I gave up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072914506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1575265284}
review: Когда-то, когда деревья были большими, а доллар - совсем маленьким, довелось работать в "универе" на мощных суперкомпьютерах 80386DX2-40 с видеокартами Trident (если мой склероз мне не изменяет). И вот однажды в руки мне попал сей "шедевр". "Что это? С чем это едят?" - подобные вопросы если и мучили меня, то очень недолго, так как скоро я попал под чары ADOM (ну и, разумеется, своей фантазии). Увлекательнейший сюжет, интересные навыки, полноценная "кукла", мощные артефакты, изобилие монстров... Потом, когда появилась первая Diablo, все ею восторгались, но я-то всё это уже видел! ;-) Много позже попробовал и Angband , и Moria - забавно, интересно, но с ADOM им не сравниться. Потом, через кучу времени наткнулся на новость, что Thomas Biskup, создатель игры, развернул краудфандинговую компанию по сбору средств на новый ADOM (с шашками и гимназистками). Я в данном мероприятии поучаствовал и сейчас являюсь счастливым обладателем открытки от Thomas Biskup и мануала по игре. ;-) Но это не главное, самое главное, что сейчас к новому ADOM может приобщиться любой пользователь Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052563337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1575224130}
review:
Pros:
- Great for masochists.
- Quick to uninstall.

Cons:
- Hardcoded perma death, every time you die your (one) save game is deleted and you must start from the beginning.
- Difficult, died 13 times during the first 2 hours (on normal mode, and that doesn't even give you any achievements).
- My character teleporting randomly within every dungeon at random times, often right into the middle of a horde of monsters, have no idea why.
- Monsters/enemies constantly popping out of nowhere, often from a direction you just cleared.
- Weapons made useless due to water, acid and heavy use, no idea where to get new ones, found someone selling a halberd. For 5000 gold. I had 200.
- Disorienting keyboard shortcuts, easy to see it's an ancient DOS game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062234668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 43857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34213, 'last_played': 1594971812}
review:
I'm a huge ADOM fan. Played it since the mid-late 90's. Prolly before some of you were even born, ha. I think the Steam version of the game does a great job at bringing ADOM to a new generation. I love that there's a lot more interesting artifacts and more dungeons than the classic ADOM I played decades ago, too. I've gotten so used to the graphics tiles that I don't even play in ASCII any more!

ADOM is still my favorite roguelike after all this time. It's not for everyone (and I wouldn't dare play it without the ADOM wiki to refer to) but for me, it has nostalgia factor, endless replayability, and crushing difficulty for us purists who play "hard mode." Mr. Biskup, I can't wait to see Ultimate ADOM!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023851266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1594, 'last_played': 1704039438}
review: A classic roguelike game that's fun playing it normally but it also gives you tons options to customize your experience. It allows you to turn off hunger or at least turn down the severity of being hungry. There are options to choose how tough or easy enemies are or if the game will roll favorable dice rolls for skills or attacks or if you want a permadeath run vs reloadable saves. Tons of races / classes / birthsigns to choose from which allow for some interesting runs. There is a free version but it's ASCII only and there arent nearly as many customizeable options. The paid version has a nice looking tileset or you can play it in vanilla ASCII. 10/10 would die again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001513324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 41005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1703202389}
review: Jedyna gra która nie chce mi sie znudzic od lat 90. Gra która dostarczyla mi wiecej frustracji niz radosci, a mimo wszystko odpalam ja wciáz od nowa. Smigala juz na moim 486 SX 25MHz i w koncu nastal czas zeby zaplacic za te wszytskie lata zabawy. Od strony technicznej moge tylko powiedziec, ze gra cechuje sie rewelacyjna grafika (pod warunkiem ze masz niebanalna wyobraznie) i miodnoscia poziom kosmos. Nie da sie jej z niczym porownac.

author: {'steamid': '76561198217479832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 21249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7032, 'last_played': 1653944008}
review:
Это просто прекрасно. И когда говорят, что эта игра разрушит вашу жизнь -- это скорее правда, чем ложь. Она очень сложная, очень разнообразная, каждое сочетание класса и расы создаёт немного отличающийся геймплей, а некоторые сочетания так вообще играются ну ОЧЕНЬ по-разному. Если пытаться всеми играть одинаково, то далеко не пройдёшь. Нужно думать, пытаться сделать неочевидные вещи с имеющимся шмотом и окружением, грамотно использовать тактику и стратегию и ВСЁ, чем может похвастаться ваш перс. Дичайше затягивает, очень много вещей, которые не прописаны в мануал, до которых приходится додумываться самостоятельно, и именно этим игра так притягательна. Количество способов, которыми можно "выйти" из игры (пройти/сдаться/умереть/что-то ещё, наверно) -- сотни, если не больше. И простая смерть в бою -- самый банальный из них. Игра постоянно преподносит сюрпризы там, откуда ты их не ждёшь, так что либо ты постоянно начеку, либо твой перс умирает при дурацких обстоятельствах. Третьего не дано :)
PS. Помните: убежать, трусливо поджав хвост лучше, чем начать игру сначала, особенно если играешь уже не первую неделю или месяц.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014892584', 'num_games_owned': 1189, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 6274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2777, 'last_played': 1575490435}
review:
I've played this shit since 1998. \m/ The best roguelike ever. Tons of interesting mechanics, monsters, locations. Even quests are, well, iconic (that poor shitty dog). Tileset version is nice, but for true ADOM experience you can turn on ASCII. Text version is still very beautiful. Thomas Biskup got the colors and the width of locations just right. Critters' colors and letters are nice and informative. All and all - great game, timeless classic, highly reccomended.

Скачала первую для себя версию, прочитав об игре восторженный отзыв в одном из первых номеров Навигатора Игрового Мира, сразу по первому выходу в интернет. Через FTP, которым тогда пользоваться толком не умела, но скачала успешно. И пропала для общества и школы недели на две. Очень хорошая игра, лучший, на мой взгляд, рогалик из всех, что играла. Играла во многое, zAngband, NetHack, ToME, Brogue, DooMRL, Cataclysm: DDA, Gearhead, Dungen Crawl: Stone Soup, IVAN и др. ADOM - все равно первая любовь, которая не ржавеет.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022866997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1573511958}
review:
If you ever played Rogue and have nostalgic dreams of doing so again, just play this instead.  I'm not suggesting this because this has graphics or because Rogue pales in comparison, but because of the QoL improvements this brings specifically...and the graphics.

At the core it still reminds you of Rogue while exploring dungeons, but with the additions of towns, quests, NPCs, and other things, the overall experience is elevated.  Sure, there are still bugs/glitches in this version, such as the music simply cutting out or lag/freezes from a game that doesn't really tax your system, but overall they don't really detract from the gameplay.  As for the RNG - I don't find it any more or less forgiving than Rogue, good or bad.

The only real complaint I'd have is the price.  Yes, there is a ton of replayability, customization, and content (after you've died quite a bit), but if you are a fan of the genre the price won't matter - otherwise catch it on a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972014273', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1683674423}
review:
I have been playing ADoM in one form or another since 1999. I love the original ASCII graphics immensely, but I am really happy to have a fully supported tileset for ADoM as my eyes sure aren't getting better with age!

Along with Nethack, Angband, and Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup, ADoM is one of the great successors to Rogue. These are all hardcore Roguelikes, nothing 'lite' about them!
It can take a while to get into the game (even now I rarely win when I play) but it is a deep experience with many synergies and playstiles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052320154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1591730483}
review:
I was kind of enjoying this game, as I like roguelikes. I do not mind RNG fucking me over, but it has to be manageable while not being tedious to manage. I was fine dying multiple times, but then I ran into a Vile Spirit and found the mechanic of stat draining. 

Yep, permanent stat drains without being able to remove it at an altar or something like that. You are just shit out of luck. So you need to get missile weapons on every hero you play and just tiptoe around these monsters. Personalized mode has no way of turning these off either. Such a badly implemented mechanic that is there to just annoy you serves me no purpose. Destroy my armor- I get another one, make me sick- I will find a way to cure myself. Decrease my stats and fuck you.

Refunding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028739006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1654933416}
review:
ADOM es un roguelike de ambientación fantástica publicado en 1994, y que sigue las reglas clásicas de cualquier roguelike: dificultad, rejugabilidad, muerte permanente, miles de monstruos y objetos, decenas de clases para el PJ ... Casi la única diferencia (para bien) es que tiene unos gráficos 2D muy buenos para un género en que la norma es que no haya gráficos. 

En juego en sí es GRATUITO, y se puede bajar desde su página oficial. La versión de Steam, de pago, añade algunas características, como una mayor libertad a la hora de crear personajes, o un modo de juego sin muerte permanente. Además, es una forma de apoyar al creador del juego.

A mi me parece muy entretenido para echar una partida de vez en cuando. Si te gusta el género, éste es un clásico, al menos deberías echarle un vistazo a la versión gratuita.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987418739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1569774405}
review: It's an okay game but I got bored with it very quickly. The graphics are nice but something about the gameplay was lacking; I just can't put my finger on what.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013690093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 23780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23145, 'last_played': 1601375204}
review:
Gut aber nicht herausragend. So bei 7.5 von 10 Punkten.

Gut:

Athmosphärische Welt. Tolles Tileset. Intelligentes, vielfältiges Spielsystem. Macht wirklich Spaß.

Nicht gut:

Nicht vorhandenes Tutorial. Man weiß am Anfang nicht wo man sinnvoll hin soll und wo man nicht hin darf - später auch nicht. Guides strotzen vor Abkürzungen und  unerklärten Begriffen.  Prozentsatz der "unfairen" Tode zu hoch - z.B. im Vergleich mit Dungeoncrawl Stonesoup. z.b. man biegt um eine Ecke oder öffnet eine Tür, wird sofort dauergestunnt und das wars. "Sterben soll Spaß machen in Roguelikes" - ok ok aber nicht so oft ohne dass man was falsch gemacht hat. Kurz gesagt: das Roguelike Prinzip oft zu plump umgesetzt. 

Trotzdem macht's Spaß und wenn man seinen Frust überwunden hat will man's gerne noch mal neu probieren. Deshalb Empfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992717088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1567248486}
review: Not quite. Refund requested. Can't sell loot, frequent glitches, nah refund please.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993261690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1172, 'last_played': 1567548267}
review: ADOM has been an excellent game for over 20 years, and the amount of effort put into it shows. Unlike some other games of the genre, it's less frustrating and less luck based, too, in the sense that every problem you're presented is guaranteed to have at least one solution available and you're not just down to the whims of random number generators to get the stuff you need to progress. Also stupid instant deaths are pleasantly few and far between. Definitely worth a shot if you're into classic roguelikes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005688179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 23839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11397, 'last_played': 1695908483}
review:
ADOM is an exceptional game and will provide effectively endless entertainment to the right people.  The scale of the adventure, the unceasing difficulty, and the importance of small increases in effectiveness that add up over time are the meat and potatoes of this rogue-like.  ADOM is one of those games where reading the Wikis, tactica, and item descriptions do not water down the sense of awe and achievement that you receive by being immersed in this world - consider that merely homework as assigned.  

I have not yet beaten ADOM.  After trying a variety of combinations, I've settled on one that I'm using as a tool for personal learning and growth - to see what I prefer as a player.  This does, of course, impact the game played - each race/class will play differently.  I think this is the path intended.  ADOM is not mastered so much as danced with; missteps will send you back to the beginning and getting comfortable is a great way to get in trouble. In fact, my latest game was one where I forgot to request divine intervention despite being very able to do so.  It is very possible to get tilted.  That's ADOM - you have to bring your wits with you. If your style of gaming is something casual with low stakes,  you should be popping coins in a game starring Mario.  If you are willing to invest a little of yourself into learning the game on its terms, you're in for a treat that doesn't end.

UPDATE
_________
Since this review, I've had the pleasure of finishing this game multiple times including an Ultra Ending as a Dark Elf Wizard (Consider that Easy Mode BTW).  ADOM is the game I nominate each year as the Labor of Love and I feel it deserves it annually - at least until Dwarf Fortress comes in as a competitor.  ADOM is phenomenal.  It has a depth and richness that you don't find often and certainly not in the true Rogue-Like genre where mechanics trump storytelling.  I am a fan and I look forward to playing ADOM for another 400 hours.

review: An incredibly deep, difficult and rewarding perma-death game that will always find ways to kill you. I've been sacrificed, drowned, crushed beneath my inventory, paralyzed, petrified, mutated, starved, poisoned, incinerated, frozen, eaten and dissolved. 10/10 would die again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198252134524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 11417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8501, 'last_played': 1667578724}
review: A diamond in the rough, ADOM is one of the easiest roguelikes I have played, easily scoring 4 wins before even getting to see the bug temple and also one of the more poorly coded I've played (and this is quite the contested title I'm afraid) slowing down terribly and even killing my character once or twice due to the inexplicable lag and even corrupted my (permadeath!) save file. Performance issues aside, this is a very fine roleplaying experience with an unique morality and karma system that really makes your character feel like a living personage in the world of Ancardia at times. The Talent system provides a lot of customization for your characters, but as you progress in the game you will notice you will always end up using the same handful weapons and skills between runs. It's combat system is also much deeper than the usual bump to attack mechanic with its Tactic settings where you must select your battle stance for your combat action. Where ADOM really shines is in its overworld, several times throughout the game you must make important choices to where go and what to do next in order to progress (and survive the journey there!), these vary between games and can make or break your run as you can tackle the mandatory and optional dungeons at different times and this freedom is what makes me come back to the game over and over. Most of ADOM's difficulty comes from learning what to punch what to hit with ranged attacks and what never to poke even with a ten foot pole, there are also a few killer dungeon master "Aha!" moments that you must learn to avoid through out its static and non procedural generated Main Quest. ADOM's music is great, its sound effects are grating and bad and it's graphics aren't stellar but the gameplay makes up for its shortcomings in the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008304704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2315, 'last_played': 1628362541}

author: {'steamid': '76561197974008645', 'num_games_owned': 814, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1561532391}
review: ADOM is one of the great classic roguelike games, now available on Steam with a graphics pack to make it more accessible. There are a lot of race/class combinations to start with, and items and spells are randomly found to make each playthrough different as well. The overworld is fixed and provides you with some known structure to your playthrough, but the layout of each dungeon is randomized so the actual gameplay is very much based on exploration and luck.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963375191', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1681859857}
review:
Do not get fooled by my playtime, most of my time playing this game has been on the free text version. Just bought the graphic version (which is ok for this types of games) to support the developer cos this is the best roguelike game ever made.

I still remember my character death on the hands of an iron golem 13 years ago, and i will never forget the amount of entertainment i got from this piece of art.

if u are a fan of roguelike games its a must buy, if u never played one but u eager to learn them u are in for an awesome ride. I do recommend any RPG fans to try it.
just remember in roguelikes character death is just part of the game :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198052517797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 6507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4886, 'last_played': 1633322708}
review:
I remember this game back from when i owned an ancient machine running DOS.
Went through quite a hell of a lot of hours back in the day on this.
Still great fun to jump in and chuck some time into it when i need to relieve some boredom.
If you are into Dungeon Crawler games i really suggest you give this a go.
it is one of the early games that i remember playing in its ASCII version.
no graphics only text. was great fun back then, and still great fun now.
A true pioneer game of the genre that has stood the test of time and any and every fan of the genre really needs to give this a go

What does it do?!

author: {'steamid': '76561198095158531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3920, 'last_played': 1682359002}
review: Version 3.3.3Could have been ALOT better. From mediocre to garbage professions, leveling takes too long, too hard to get more of them attributes, moloch's and undead generally kick melee users ass(moloch's one hit kills,alot of armour, resists mind control while undead increases your age when they hit you) too hard to know which way to go, not being able to forcefully puke to ignore bloated, non strength characters have waaaay too little carry possibilities. author: {'steamid': '76561198379932487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1584486388}
review:
i just... i just can't get past the first dungeon without dying. and while crushing difficulty is baked into games like this, it's punishing to the point that I feel quite let down with this game -- playing for nearly ten hours you'd think there would be some way to learn how to stay alive but no. and with each death i don't feel i have learned anything and there is no progression in the constant losing, no moment where you figure out 'ah ha! now i've got it a little more figured out!'. It's just a cycle of: make a character, get into the game, visit the starting village, get the quests, die shortly after, repeat.

1 YEAR LATER EDIT: just downloaded it again to see if i could give it another go and no, simply can't do it. died again in the first cave. i play A LOT of roguelikes and this has to be the worst of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075847646', 'num_games_owned': 2229, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1583175193}
review: Почти четверть века назад вышел оригинальный АДОМ. Почти все это время каждый рогаликодел обещает, что, увидев его творение, Томас Бискуп (создатель АДОМа) нервно закурит в сторонке. Время идет, Бискуп не нервничает, АДОМ все еще один из лучших рогаликов, а может и самый лучший. И если, когда-то давно, чтобы разобраться в этой игре приходилось читать тонны мануалов и учиться, словно оператор матрицы, видеть в ....@....D героев, подземелья и драконов, то сейчас и обучение подвезли и замечательную минималистичную графику. Казуалам проходить мимо, новоявленным любителям РПГ обязательно ознакомиться с классикой, остальные и так все знают.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996224499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1701047429}
review:
I love this game more than life itself, don't let the "time played" fool you - I've been playing this game consistently for the past ten years (the freeware version that is). It's all the fun of Nethack but with RPG elements that make it just an absolute treasure. Every game is unique, every class is unique, every combination of every item is unique, it's just endless hours of varied and exciting gameplay, and just when I feel like I've explored all the game has to offer it throws something new at me.

10/10, favorite in the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027984603', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1553778043}

author: {'steamid': '76561197964084906', 'num_games_owned': 1794, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1612413680}
review:
Honstly I didnt know what to expect about this game.
I have been play rogue, roguelite and permadeath games for years on years now since text adventure games as a kid.

How to describe ADOM....
This game is unforgiving, insanely unpredictable and sometimes extremely tactical.

You can be farming lizard man who had their parents sell them to a slaver
You can be a highelf cut throat is betrayed by your god when you need them most.

This may not be the prettiest game if you are looking for something to replace The Witcher in the sense of aesthetics but I can say that if you want something with heart and depth with freedom of direction to die how you like.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993605316', 'num_games_owned': 547, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 4034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3696, 'last_played': 1625923858}
review:
Те кто уже знаком с оригинальной игрой - и так все знают. Данный обзор для тех, кто не играл в оригинальную игру Томаса.
Сразу оговорюсь, это игра не для всех. В общем-то ее можно поделить на две части. В режиме "story mode" не заморачиваясь на значительную часть комплексных механик игры вы можете попытаться пройти ее ради сюжета. Я не оговорился - попытаться, ибо даже этот режим может преподнести сюрпризы. В конце концов, чем вам помогут сохранения/загрузки если вы банально не можете убить противника потому что ваш герой слишком слаб? Режим истории здесь скорее режим обучения нежели действительно простой режим где можно пройти игру ради истории. Отсюда главный и пожалуй единственный минус игры - высокая сложность. ДА, игра требует от вас продумывать свои действия и решения, а самое главное - не рисковать почем зря. Второй режим? Настоящий хардкор, где 90% персонажей погибают у первой же деревни, потому что, как и в жизни, лазить одному по пещерам и диким землям крайне опасно.
В ней нет поблажек игроку - качали только навык владения мечами? А вот вам ржавый монстр который сожрал ваш последний меч и выплюнул огрызок. А вот вкачали бы вы хотя бы немного навык владения дубинами, отдубасили бы его уже этой деревянной дубинкой что носите про запас и сохранили бы свой меч в целости. В этом пожалуй вся суть - разнеженные современными играми, мы привыкли что игра всегда дает нам шанс выкрутиться, что любого врага можно одолеть. Но не здесь. В ADOM нужно заранее продумать порядок своих действий - что делать если меня окружат? Сколько нужно взять провианта чтобы не умереть от голода на нижних уровнях той пещеры? Стоит ли спускаться на еще один уровень вниз если PowerPoints (мана в других играх) на нуле? Если заранее продумать свою стратегию, многое становится проще. К сожалению, именно это нам и лениво делать. Поэтому я не согласен с теми рецензентами, кто говорит что в игре запредельный рандом. Он только кажется таковым, потому что мы с вами (как игроки) не приложили ни грамма усилий чтобы этот рандом контролировать. Мы каждый раз под давлением привычек срываемся и начинаем играть как привыкли в других играх - наобум. С шашкой наголо несемся вперед вопя что-то несуразное, а потом с удивлением обнаруживаем себя посередине комнаты, набитой монстрами. 
Не надо пить из лужи, если вы не готовы в нее упасть!
Обязательно прочитайте гайды по игре, советы новичку, начните с класса попроще. И думайте. Что вас будет спасать? прыткие ноги или толстая кожа? Чем вы будете бить врагов? А если это не эффективно? Всегда трезво оценивайте риски, не совершайте ненужных поступков и тогда вы получите удивительный опыт, какой способна подарить не каждая игра.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160275100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 32156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22047, 'last_played': 1706232459}
review:
One of the best rougelike games I have ever played.  There are many choices of race and class combinations from elf to ratling duelist to wizard, thief and assassin to gnomes and orcs, all of which have depth to them.

The classes each play differently and gain different abilities as you level, some being intentionally harder to play than others.

Good beginning classes are archers for keeping everything at range, beastfighters for being able to barehanded melee most things to death, and elementalists for an auto-renewing selection of damage spells to clear rooms.

The story is also surprisingly good, make sure you talk to any named characters you meet, there is a whole lot of interesting lore to be discovered beyond the main story and multiple endings are possible.

Difficulty - Rougelikes (for those who don't know) are known for their difficulty and the fact that death is permament, meaning you must create a new character when you die (though in recent versions this can be toggled off) 

Adom is very unforgiving but also very skill based, generally if you know what your doing you'll only die from your own mistakes (there are exceptions of course - triggering a door trap at level 1 before your stong enough to survive for example)

Graphics - the graphics are not the best, but they are much better than they were (though some preferred the ASCII version) and are more than sufficient to convey everything you need to know.

Controls - Controls are reasonably intuitive, and mouse functionality has been improved to the point where you can easily handle most actions without difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986489479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1547274265}

author: {'steamid': '76561198075598103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 12160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2709, 'last_played': 1631338733}
review:
시작은 1.1.1 버전 탈렌트 생긴 시점부터 했고

지금까지 클리어는 위자드,엘리멘탈리스트, 팔라딘 3개만 해봤다가

이번에 나눔으로 선물받은 기념으로 허틀링 아쳐 클리어후 겸사겸사 후기겸 평가를 작성합니다.



ADOM은 뭐 더 말할게 없을 정도로 잘만든 게임입니다.


종족이나 직업마다 특색도 그럭저럭 있고, 다양한 아이템과 퀘스트, 그리고 넓은 월드맵. 여러 오브젝트 간의 상호작용이 재밌는 게 많아서 좋았습니다. 게임을 하다보면 제작자가 얼마나 이 게임에 애정을 갖고 게임을 다듬어나갔는지 몸에 스며들 정도로 느껴집니다.



지금 부터는 그간 느낀 좆같은 점들



1. 너무 많이 쑤셔 넣음


ADOM은 하면서 느끼는거지만 월드맵도 있고, 퀘스트도 많고 너무 방대하게 게임을 만들고

또 지금도 쑤셔넣는 중이라, 한 번 하고나면 피곤함이 장난이 아님, 콤팩트 하게 깼는데도 10시간에서 15시간 정도 걸렸음 느긋하게 탐험도 하고 했으면 20시간 정도 걸렸을 것 같은데,
이렇게 너무 큰 볼륨은 로그라이크 장르와 잘 맞지 않는 것 같음.

특히 로그라이크라서 부활 아뮬렛 있는거 아닌이상 죽으면 오랫동안 하던걸 날리는 거라 그 좌절감이 정말 너무 심함. 




2.기능상의 불편함 문제.


게임 자체가 다르기도 하지만 돌죽하면서  O - tab - 컨트롤F -컨트롤 O  써보고 신세계라고 느꼈음, 

A. 이 게임은 던전 한 층이 돌죽보다 훨씬 작아서 굳이 자동 탐색이 필요없다고 생각했는지
기능도 늦게 도입 되었고, 많이 엉성함. 탐색하는 것도 영 석연치 않고 발자국 표시도 없고 그냥 못미더움.

B. 특히나 돌죽의 경우 컨트롤 O, 컨트롤 F 키로 특이 던전이 어디 있었는지, 아이템이 어디 있는지 검색하는 기능이 있었는데 ADOM은 그런 기능, 말하자면 컴퓨터가 대신 기억해주는 기능이 떨어져서 모든 특이사항은 플래이어가 스스로 기억하던지 직접 메모장에 적야되어 무척 불편함. 스케일이 커서 그런 기능을 만들기 힘들었을 수도 있겠지만 오히려 그래서 없는 것이 크게 불편하게 느껴짐, 

C. 자동줍기 모드도, 아이템 별로 설정 가능 한 것이 아니라, 카테고리 전체를 줍는 거고, 주변에 적이 있건 없건 무조건 주워서 너무 기능들이 1차원 적인 것 같았음. 물론 아이템의 종류가 너무 방대해서 그렇다고는 하나. 아쉽게 느껴짐. 차라리 지금처럼 카테고리 뿐만 아니라. \ 키를 누르면 나오는 이미 밝혀진 아이템 중에서 취사선택 하는 기능이 좀 있었으면 함.


D. 추가로 자기 세부스텟, 자기가 은신감지가 있는지, 어떤 속성에 이뮨인지, 레지인지, 텔레포트 컨트롤이 있는지. 보려면 insight 포션을 마시거나 주문을 써야됨 난 이거 진짜 너무 불편하고 왜 이런 시스템인지 이해를 못하겠음.

E. 마지막으로 아이템의 제대로 된 기능을 보려면 great identify 스크롤을 찢어야 돼서 제대로 알지도 못하고 아이템을 쓰는 경우가 많음. 스크롤은 턱없이 부족하고 스크롤 하나당 아이템 하나만 나오니, 결국 아이템 정보를 얻으려면 wiki같은 외부 사이트에 의존하게  되는데 이건 진짜 이러면 안 된다고 생각함.


전체적으로 말하자면 편의기능이 너무 떨어짐. 컴퓨터 게임인데 플래이어가 일일히 손대야 되는게 참 귀찮음.



3. 크리티컬이 아닌 이상 별 의미가 없는 기본공격들

크리티컬 계산식이 데미지 2배인데 단순히 최종 데미지가 2배가 되는게 아니라 적의 방어력 감소 전에 두배를 계산하는 식이라

데미지 50에 상대 방어력이 40이면 기본 공격은 10 이지만, 크리티컬은 (50*2-40) = 60임

실질 데미지가 6배 차이남. 이게 후반가서 적들의 방어력이 증가하고 그럴 수록 이런식으로 좀 공격이 크리티컬에 의존이 심함, 

게다가 이 게임은 로그라이크 게임이라 안전하게 원거리에서 공격하는게 전술적으로 정말 중요한데, 안 그래도 유리한 원거리 무기가 너무 강함.

원거리 미사일의 크리티컬 배수가 3~6배 정도고 무조건 해당 속성에 크리티컬을 터트릴 수 있는 슬래잉 화살 같은게 있어서 파괴력이 상상을 초월함. 최종 몬스터인 발러같은것도 상성 맞춰서 데몬 슬레잉 화살 3번 4번만 쏴서 크리티컬 계속 터트리면 그냥 죽어버림, 그런데 또 그렇다고 그런 몬스터들과 근접으로 상대하기는 너무 험난하고 그래서. 중간이 없는 것 같음.


따라서 모든 케릭터가 마법을 안 쓰면 무조건 활이라도 써야 됨. 그게 너무 강제되는 거 같음. 반대로 갖춰지기만 하면 게임이 후반부터는 너무 쉬워짐.



4. 노가다 강요


텔레포트 컨트롤을 얻기위해 블링크 도그를 일부러 계속 수를 늘리면서 잡거나

허브 노가다, 무한던전 노가다, 신앙도 노가다, 우물 마셔서 위시 찾는거 등등..

이런식으로 노가다 할 것이 너무 많음. 안해도 된다고는 하는데 솔직히 노가다 하고 안 하고 차이가 너무 심해서 유혹이 너무 강함 특히나 한 번 죽으면 끝인 로그라이크 게임이라 준비는 튼튼하게 할 수 밖에 없음.

그리고 문제는 이런 식으로 밑준비 실컷하고 모험좀 즐기다 죽는다? 좌절감이 너무 심하게 옴.


5. 좁은 길


클리어 까지 가기 위해서는 몇가지 퀘스트들을 통과하면서 가야 되는데

문제는 이것들이 쭈욱 연결되어 있음 그런데 그 길이 너무 좁아서 한 번이라도 삐끗하면 지긋한 노가다가시작됨.

예를들면 카지노 입구의 경비병을 치우기 위한 반지를 먹으려면 등산 장비를 먹고 무덤에서 스켈레톤 킹을 죽여야 됨,

물론 등산 장비가 피라미드에서 하나 나오는데 그거 날려먹으면 나올 때까지 하염없이 노가다를 해야 됨, 반대로 이미 선맥을 넘은 상태에서 등산장비가 모종의 이유로 파손되면 등산장비가 나올 때까지 무한정 노가다가 시작되는 그런 꼴임.


또 다른 예로는 영원한 화염의 탑에 가려면 ring of ice 얼음반지가 있어야 착용한 장비가 타지 않음.  중립 성향이면 하나 확정적으로 나오긴 하는데

이 아이템 하나를 얻기 위해서 

텔레포트 컨트롤을 얻는다 - 아이템 위치나 맵을 볼 수 있는 아이템을 준비한다. - 텔레포트 완드를 먹는다 - 그 완드로 드워프 마을에서 반지를  얻는다. - 화염의 탑을 공략한다.

이런 식으로 그 난관들의 밑준비 작업들이 다 세세하게 연결되어있고. 그 중에 뭐 하나가 틀어지면 랜덤 드랍으로 나오길 바라며 하염없이 노가다를 해야만 함.


물론 그런 아이템이 준비가 안 되어도 진행을 하고자 하면 억지로 진행 할 수야 있겠지만, 제대로 된 준비가 안 되면 그러한 관문을 통과하는 것이 너무나도 고됨. 고된다는 것은 죽을 가능성이 높다는 것이고, 로그라이크 장르에서 죽음을 각오하고 싶은 사람이 얼마나 될까 싶음. 이 게임은 이런 것들이 좀 있음.


결론을 말하자면 얼핏 보기에는 월드맵도 있고 이것저것 자유롭게 넓은 맵을 탐험 할 수 있을 것 같지만, 사실은 모든 관문들이 독립적이 아니라 대부분 연결 되어 있음, 그리고 그 연결 고리에서 한번 삐끗하면 다시 정상궤도에 오르기가 너무 힘듬.


6. 좆같은 커럽션

돌죽으로 치면 커럽션은 변이라고 생각하면 됨

문제는 이게 몬스터에게 맞거나 포션을 먹어야만 생기는 것이 아니라 배경 커럽션이라고

그냥 턴이 흘러도 장소에 따라 자동으로 변이 수치가 쌓임,  그렇게 변이가 16개인가 18개인가 쌓이면 그대로 카오스 생명체로 바뀌면서 게임 오버임

그래서 천천히 전략적으로 게임을 풀어나갈 수 없음

돌죽처럼 체력 떨어지면 느긋하게 숫자 5 눌러서 쉬면서 체력 체우거나, 다른 지역에서 줍지않고 버렸던 아이템을 들고오고,  또 다른 던전 돌면서 경험치도 좀 올리면서 캐릭터를 강화해서 돌파를 시도하고 이런 플래이가 힘들어짐(천천히 하다보면 커럽션 쌓여서 게임 오버니까.)

그래서 게임 내내 존나 압박감이 느껴짐,  맵도 넓고 하고싶은 것도 많고 그런데 게임 자체가 너무 등을 떠미는 느낌이 강함. 굉장히 불쾌함.


7. 경험치와 레벨업 디자인의 문제점.

레벨업 필요 경험치설정, 그 설계가 너무 구림. 초반 15레벨 정도까지는 그냥저냥 잘 올라가는데 그 이후로는 습득량에 비해 요구량이 너무나 높게 설계되어 있어 성장이 완전히 정체되어버림.

애당초 경험치 얻는게 너무 이상함. 대부분의 몬스터는 정말 별로 의미 없는 적은량의 경험치를 줄 뿐이라. 경험치 습득량이 너무 적어 레벨업의 기약이 없음. 일부 오브던전 몬스터나, 보스들이 주는 엄청난 경험치만이 레벨업에 의미있게 느껴짐. 


까놓고 말해서 게임 막바지까지도 레벨업 좆도 안 되다가  D50에 나오는 발러같은거 한두마리에 레벨 쭉쭉 올라가게 만드는 이런 븅신같은 디자인 때문에 대부분의 전투가 지루하게 느껴짐. 잡나 스킵하나 별 차이도 없는 거 같으니까. 특히 두드러 지는 부분이 오브사원 사이의 특색없는 층들을 내려 갈 때임. 의미없고 지루함.

또한 게임을 클리어 하더라도 50레벨까지 도달하지 못하는 경우가 수두룩함. 나 뿐만 아니라 포럼의 게임 클리어 로그를 봐도 50레벨 클리어가 아닌 경우가 무척 많음. 그래서 심지어 게임을 클리어 했는데도 불구하고 캐릭터의 능력을 십분 활용하지 못한 것 같아서 아쉬움이 많이 남음.. 여하튼 레벨업 관련해서 조절하긴 해야 된다고 봄.


8. 미친 도전과제


씨8새끼야 상직적으로 speed demon 1만턴 클리어 이게 가능하냐? 도전과제 하나씩 밀어보다가 현타와서 접었다. 

끝

author: {'steamid': '76561198112810429', 'num_games_owned': 2594, 'num_reviews': 578, 'playtime_forever': 10747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10686, 'last_played': 1541972965}
review:
First things first: I've played ADOM right after I've bought my first PC in 1998, and it was fabulous. That ADOM here is the very same fabulous game, with the addition of mouse control, new visuals and some new classes/features. SO, if you're an old fan, don't listen to me, buy this game, it's worth any pence of its price.

However... the time actually flows, and we're not the same persons as we were yesturday. Players now are different. Games now are different. Thomas Biskup made a great game in 1994, but after then... He'd better be creating some new worlds rather than holding this one in life.

As of benefits and "pro" points for ADOM people usually calls the gross variety of choices and outcomes. I'm sorry, but the only gross in variables is the pre-start player character generation. 22 classes * 12 races * 12 birthsigns + stats + traits... that really feels as helluva of options! However, all the variety of classes, all the plethora of skills and hidden traits - worth nothing thanks to the high randomization principle of all combats in the game.

As of 2019 year cRPG player, I can't stand neither the principles of level generation (especially the structure of the main dungeon), nor the "quests" in ADOM. They are too conventional, primitive and unrealistic. Unfair too (maybe it's the main issue).

Finally, ADoM is a game for explicit, self-realized masochists, who are taking the fun of "what kind of perma-death I've gathered today". If you're thinking that I'm just a puny weakling - you're either not played ADOM at all, or you're one of those 0,001% of people who actually beaten the game at least once. By my honest calculations, a mere player have to invest about 500 hours to achieve that, and XXXX hours to be a proper "ProPlayer" there. Considering the fact that all that time goes not for billions of stories and the real variety of gameplay, but the boring comprehension of the basic game mechanics, pushing through constant random deaths... I don't really have enough lifetime for this. Sorry, Thomas, but I think you need to finally set the princess in some another castle.

I mark ADOM as 6/10, but it's good only as epitaph of the former glory. There are many of the better games at moment, starting from ToME, and all the way to the newest titles. 

PS: 100 ADOM releases, most of which are bug fixes!!! C'mon, it's too much perfection on the simple rhyme!

Русская версия обзора на сайте: https://specialgamesclub.ru/user-reviews/adom-velikaya-igra-v-svoyom-zhanre-no-ochen-staraya/

author: {'steamid': '76561197991371023', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 34243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16123, 'last_played': 1704675132}
review:
Adom has been one of my long-standing favorite games throughout my life, and when it comes to roguelikes, I still prefer them ASCII based, however ADOM is one of the few that gets graphics right. The graphics are reasonably middle-of-the-road, being simplistic enough for everything to appropriately stand out from the environment, but are subtly animated and overall very appealing. I find "simple" to be a quality that is very hard to do correctly, regardless of whether it is graphics, music, food, or anything else life has to offer, but ADOM pulls it off well. 

The music is also approrpriate- a good soundtrack tends to fade into background of your awareness, neither being too loud or quiet, too over the top, or too subtle, but just catching your consciousness now and then despite generally being always there.

Beyond this, what more can I say? ADOM is one of the largest, oldest, and continually updated roguelikes out there, and it actually has a plot beyond "go retrieve the endgame-McGuffin" that determines *how* you save the world... IF you choose to save it at all.

If you are new to roguelikes, I highly suggest this game, because there is a newcomer mode that lets you take it easy, whether it is removing permadeath, or tons of wishes to begin with, or even just a simple tutorial mode to get you on your way... but if You've been playing roguelikes ever since Rogue, ADOM will scratch that itch for you as well, being just as challenging as Rogue ever was.

The ASCII version is still free for download at ADOM's site, but ADOM is one of those games worth supporting, whether it is by taking part of the Postcard Quest (anyone know if he still accepts postcards?), or by paying for the full-graphics version.

review: Of all the games of this type I've played, this has been the most fun and the most accessible. It's difficult, yes. And sometimes I wish there was a bit more to do, but that may be my fault for not diving (or delving) deep enough. But it makes for a fun experience with lots of different options at your disposal.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1545381113}
review:
[b][i]Review copy provided by developer via Curator Connect[/i][/b]

If you’ve ever dabbled in the foundational classics of the roguelike genre, you’ve probably heard of ADOM. And it was probably in hushed whispers about cat lords or liches, or some esoteric rules about handling some lost temple somewhere. ADOM built a reputation for being tricky and unforgiving, even when cast against its peers like NetHack and Crawl, and you can still experience plenty of that pain even decades later. Some of the roughest edges have been smoothed over with this more mainstream makeover, but it’s still very much a game about arcane rules and deadly knowledge checks for the player. And now there’s an added element of instability that makes this recommendation an extremely qualified one.

The fanciful land of Ancardia is in terrible peril. Beneath the Drakalor Chain, the forces of chaos are stirring. Fortunately, you happen to be one of those heroic types that forges forth in search of loot and glory and ends up saving the whole shebang… or dying and restarting, anyway. While the ominous Cavern of Doom hides the source of this corruption that must be excised, there are plenty of other locations across the land that could use your attention. Musty caves, strange pyramids, and mystical temples all contain great dangers, and wondrous rewards for those who brave them.

Whereas ADOM’s contemporaries had you descending into one great dungeon complex, this title gives you an overworld and plenty of additional areas to explore in addition to its great dungeon complex. It gives the early game a little more direction as well, offering you a basic cave to explore before ushering you into a town with a few beginner quests to work through. They’re not all so simple, though… one of those quests is the infamous puppy dungeon, scourge of low-level characters throughout the ages. But I prefer this more open approach to the early game, as opposed to clearing similar dungeon levels over and over as you make new characters.

Honestly though, this is about the only allowance ADOM makes for new players. As a classic roguelike this one is just as stuffed with obscure keyboard commands and item effects as any of them, and a few of those can end up being deathly important. You’ll have no idea starting out what the relevance of a dedicated wipe-your-face button is, or why blankets end up being so important, or even which corpses you want to make sure you eat. There’s a lot of esoteric knowledge needed to survive past the early game, and it’s not always the kind that you can puzzle out yourself. Just working out the most relevant stats and skills from the deluge the game presents you with can be a tall order, much less figuring out what to do with all the unidentified potions and potentially cursed gear you’ll find.

The real pitfalls, of course, are the enemies. True to classic roguelike fashion you’re not going to know just how deadly a foe is before you engage them, and by then it’s usually too late. My last run was characterized by cleaving through foes that couldn’t do enough damage to overcome my armor, until I ran across an animated pillar of water that killed me in a single hit. These difficulty spikes aren’t even localized in bosses or traps, they’re simply monsters that happen to be the hard counter to whatever your character is, and you’ve pretty much got to eat shit once to learn what a threat they are. Some of these spikes have to be planned for hours in advance as well, so be ready for lots of sudden stops in your runs while you learn the intricacies of this one.

Even if you come to grips with the combat and the many, many systems, the game could still crash. The Steam version of ADOM is surprisingly unstable, and without unrestricted saving your character could be set back thirty minutes to an hour, or lost altogether. Supposedly it’s the updated tile graphics that cause part of the problem, but that will need to be addressed long term as you can’t have a major feature of your re-release ending runs like that. The graphics aren’t even that spot on, either, because there’s plenty of inconsistent formatting and such. It’s an odd place for a passion project like this to end up, particularly because it’s such a big feature of the roguelike landscape. But you need to be aware that ADOM is still very much the old-school ball-buster it once was, and it might even crash on you when things start getting good. I’d say it still deserves to be explored, but this release might not be the best way to make your mark on Ancardia.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/11322459/]curation page[/url]!

author: {'steamid': '76561197981185697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 3821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1560, 'last_played': 1671605818}
review:
Deurandar the Dwarven Beastfighter may not know how to read, but they're pretty confident mighty Stone Golems don't steadfastly guard dense tomes such as, err, *squints*, the [i]lavish libram[/i] in moldy dungeons for nothin'! They sure do know how to punch mighty good though, and this here tome is theirs now, if only they could read it!

Adventure, then, to the Caverns of Chaos! By Thrundarr's beard, he'll have a potion of literacy for another stalwart Dwarf in need. Mayhap then beleagured Deurandar can make sense of all these scrolls, these fistfulls of strange 'erbs! This doggedly persistent Si! Furthermore, this envelope that fell outta nowhere as if by ill-tides and magic, has a picture of a pyramid on it. Well, hop to it, you foolish dwarf! Solve your illiteracy and maybe you can save the world!

If you love adventure, a slow burning sense of discovery, and many, many deaths, look no further - this game is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065602785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1669058007}
review:
Pros:
+ Depth (e.g., race/class combos, skills, items, etc.)
+ Polish
+ Available for free from the official Website (go there and try it before buying here!)

Neutral:
+/- So-so graphics, sound, and music
+/- Keystroke-heavy UI

Cons:
- Combat is tedious and the gameplay, overall, is largely flat
- Absurd RNG (i.e., artificial difficulty) leading to many cheap deaths
- Gets boring quickly as a result

Verdict: I can see why this game is highly regarded in the genre. But, it is showing its age. If Steam provided a "meh" rating then I would go with that. My final word is that you really should try the free version first (I wish I had before racking up 3 hours).

author: {'steamid': '76561198003123296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 5373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3550, 'last_played': 1545800039}
review:
I really like this game, but there is one CRITICAL flaw: Game crash = death.

Although this is a roguelike game, and you should go through dozens of unsuccessful characters,  it sucks when you lose a successful character through no fault of your own.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012603064', 'num_games_owned': 733, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1543298095}
review: Okay.  You took the time to update the graphics but didn't even try to make the play better?  To cast a spell you gotta open your cast spell menu!  don't open the normal spell menu though which is hot keyed, to use the casting menu you have to left click blah blah blah blah blah this is awful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072491408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 12838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12301, 'last_played': 1574460936}
review:
One of the most ancient (in setting and in RL ways), deep and complicated roguelikes. Dozens years of evolutuion, first true console view on Steam. In comparison to 10-years back version it was totally redrawn, remastered, but the core of the game remained as it is.

You can spend a lot of time inside in it, but the game require patience for modern players. There are a lot of details and just attempt to understand can be interested. It leads to a lot of surprizes, because the game has a lot of different logic and way of thinking which is different to the other games.

It's too sad that the game was well known for long period of time and has a lot of fans, but because it was free there was no scuh marketing and press response from the public and critics. Maybe it will be fixed by Valve and its gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025552830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1710750796}
review: A true classic. This game has been in continuous development since the early days of the internet. I remember playing this when I was in middle school, using just ASCII characters. I think I died 20 times before I reached the first village. This is a proper roguelike, unforgiving but very rewarding if you're willing to suffer... a lot. To this day I haven't been able to complete a game, but I always enjoy cracking it open and seeing how far I can get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006029009', 'num_games_owned': 1272, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1004, 'last_played': 1601521553}
review: One the most enjoyable if not most influential of the classic Roguelikes. ADOM combines the randomness and nothing is guarunteed wonderment of most roguelikes with a story you can follow and relate to. Pick this up today!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994724994', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 946, 'last_played': 1603354802}
review:
There is a depth to ADOM that is unmatched by most other rogue-likes. This is not only due to the overland map, the randomly appearing story-dungeons and the different paths to victory you can aim for, but also from the mechanics themselves. A comprehensive skill system depends on any of the over 1000 combinations of race, class and star-sign, allowing you to create vastly different characters matching the style of play you're currently looking for.

And then you die. Often. Early, Mid or Lategame. And like Dwarf Fortress, it's "FUN" and always a learning experience.


I played ADOM first when I was doing night shift at a student job and had too much spare time. That was 25 years ago. I still play ADOM now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056257093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2376, 'last_played': 1615848776}
review:
My favorite game of all time, so joyfully upsetting. A classic and a titan in the roguelike genre. It has been revamped with nice graphic tiles, though I prefer to playwith the ASCII graphix. Very steep learning curve, You may still be learning things a decade later. The keybindings may be a little dated compared to any modern video game, though The Creator (Thomas Biskup) is and has been activily working to improve the UI.

I would definitely recommend everyone give it a try, especially if you are a fan of role playing games, and/or roguelike.

Axes HIgh!

author: {'steamid': '76561198827869234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1566676141}
review:
This game is just too complicated to be fun. First, the screen resolution settings (yes there are multiple, none of which actually use numbers until you get to the complicated stuff) don't do a thing. Nothing. Even the zoom setting does absolutely nohting. I finally figured out, completely on my own after someone pointed me to the resolution setting that has the numbers and still does nothing, that you can zoom. That was actually a tip in the advanced settings section that someone had to help me find. Something as simple as "pressing ctrl+scrolling will zoom the map" should have been in any of the multiple other screens that are easily accessed. So I finally got that to work for me and was able to play the game. I was looking through all of the settings screens for keybindings and simply could not find them. I asked around yet again and found out you have to go completely out of the game and actually edit one of the files with the keybindings settings. After trying to ed it the keybindings I couldn't get the game to load, so I asked AGAIN what was going on and was told that I had an empty command line. In order to see what line, I had to hit F10. Nothing anywhere says to hit that, but it's the button you push to go to ASCII graphics. After I-don't-even-know-how-many times I finally got all of the key bindings fixed. It seems like the easy key bindings are all used, so I had to make a lot of them CTRL+a number. Now I was finally able to play. This took at least an hour to get all set up, which is the longest I've EVER taken to set up a game with just keybindings and graphics. The first character I was able to play died within the first 2 levels of the dungeon. I received a cursed item that damanged me every turn and had no way to remove it. You see, everything you pick up just has a generic name, and you need to try verious ways to actually identify them. Until later in the game (according to the forums because there is nothing in-game) you have to rely on various skills, which probably will not work unless you're either a merchant or I think Ratling, or a scroll you can pick up. I never had the scroll. You also don't know the stats on an item either until you actually try it on. So I tried on an item and it was one that damaged me every turn, and I had no way to remove it. 1 down. The second was a spell caster. I didn't like how complicated the spell system was so I exited that character. The next one I ended up with a sickness that I couldn't get rid of either and constantly got hurt. The last one I got a cursed pair of gloves on floor four and couldn't hut anything with them and finally gave up. 

I just can't recommend this game based on how it's basically the 25 year old game with a really bad reskin. The reskin isn't even complete and some of the game information screens have the new design just sitting over the old design, so you can still see it in the background.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056717573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3648, 'last_played': 1537990103}

author: {'steamid': '76561198032457930', 'num_games_owned': 1841, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 2680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1606332318}
review:
General: 

Rating: Unable to find one. 
Price: $14.99
Genre: Roguelike, Dungeon Crawler
Time played: 10.6 Hours

An updated version of the classic rogue/dungeon crawler. More/different choices more ways to die. 

Gameplay - 8
ADOM (Ancient  Domains of Mystery) plays like most dungeon crawlers, go here kill things, level up and make your character better. You search dungeons and look for loot to make your character stronger and better able to survive. 

They have several gameplay modes ranging from easy (allows reloading of saves) to roguelike (1 live/ permadeath), each has its own scoreboard/leaderboard. I believe you can only get the achievements if you play the permadeath mode. 

There are plenty of races and classes to choose from, along with your star sign, all of which have various effects on your character, which directly affects the gameplay. 

Story -  8

You are the chosen one, go forth and kill the chaos that is creeping into this land.  I don’t remember the exact story, but that seems to be par for the course in these types of games. 

Graphics - 8

Not great, but still good.  The spell effects are nice and the monsters and characters you run across look good. 

Controls - 7 (mouse/keyboard)

I had trouble with the controls, but that’s due to me playing other roguelikes that have different control schemes.  The controls are slightly different but a lot are the same as other games of this genre.  As I play more and get used to them it wasn’t as difficult but still feel ‘off’. 

Repeatability - 10

Tons and tons to do in the game, like most roguelikes. They even have a dungeon that is endless/infinite so you can loot and farm etc etc.  And of course, you’re going to die a lot. So you’ll have lots of chances to try again. And again. And again.

Music - 8

It’s there, it fits the game. It’s nothing special but it does fit the mood of whatever’s going on in the game.

Multiplayer - N/A

Initial Thoughts:

Oh another rogue clone.  Meh.  Controls are.. Different. Not sure how I feel about this. 

 

Soma Says: 

Do you like rogue type games? Dying repeatedly to hopefully learn some new info on how to play the game?  Then this is a game for you.  The controls aside it’s a pretty solid rogue game and I full recommend that you try it out. 

I personally enjoy the fact that you can randomize everything, let fate decide your character. I’m not trying to win though, i’m just having fun.  If you are trying to win, yeah lots of luck with that. 

It’s a fun/frustrating experience trying out a new rogue game. So many things, is it important to have this skill? Should i be leveling it up? What about this? Do i need this? So many questions and the only way you can answer it is to play the game. 


If you enjoyed the review check out my curator page : https://store.steampowered.com/curator/28849369/

author: {'steamid': '76561198031521887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1648, 'last_played': 1534010596}
