author: {'steamid': '76561198045760671', 'num_games_owned': 1690, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1561866723}
review:
Must have put in several hundred hours at least in the "postcardware" version before it came to Steam. Also contributed to the croud-funding to resurect developement so there is that.

One of THE big classic Roguelike games up there with Nethack, *band variants and so on. The Steam version add graphical tiles, sound and music and improved GUI compared to the old-school ASCII version (still kinda perfeer ACSII mode but I guess the young people like some graphics in their games these days ;)).

Must admit I have lapsed a bit in playing it in recent years, but if you have never tried it before I can highly reccomend it. If you are unsure it's worth your money the free version is still available minus a few Steam spesific bonus features (and usually a version or two behind the Steam release), so give that a try at least. Then if you digg it pick up the Steam version to encourage further developement.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994127533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1511481404}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018622451', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 59368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2430, 'last_played': 1710254160}
review: Высокий порог вхождения. Кучи смертей. Миллионы возможностей.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104512819', 'num_games_owned': 365, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1477, 'last_played': 1552772806}
review:
Вот ни фига это не рогалик. Вот вообще не рогалик. Это полноценная ролевая игра, со сложным сюжетом, выбором стиля поведения, принятием решений. От рогалика тут всего две вещи - ASCII-графика (после долгих лет, проведенных в текстовом режиме, я так и не смог привыкнуть к этим дурацким тайлам) и беспощадность к персонажу (умирающему каждый раз с концами[spoiler], что впрочем можно решить при помощи wand of save/load[/spoiler]). Зато все остальное затыкает за пояс большинство современных "ролевых игр", разработчики которых считают, что наличие дерева прокачки автоматически позволяет ставить этот тэг.

Проработка деталей также на высоте. В какой еще игре будут команды типа "прочистить уши" или "вытереть лицо", которые при этом реально могут понадобиться? Когда я при первых прохождениях дошел до [spoiler]баньши, я неделю искал возможности замочить ее издалека, не входя в радиус действия ее смертельного вопля. Только потом до меня дошло, что  вроде бы совершенно бесполезный воск из улья вполне может помочь[/spoiler]. Или чего стоит вполне возможная ситуация, когда [spoiler]персонажа приносят в жертву темному божеству, если он случайно наступил на алтарь[/spoiler]. Да даже чего далеко ходить. Влияние оказывает даже календарная дата, когда была начата игра. Даже в нерандомизированной части игры всегда находится что-то пропущенное в предыдущих прохождениях. Игра вообще поражает нюансами глубинной логики типа влияния первого убитого за игру монстра на глубину залегания необходимого для прохождения артефакта.

ADoM как HL, игроки в который делятся на тех, кто не доехал на трамвае, и тех, кто прошел игру несколько сотен раз. Игроки в ADoM делятся на слабаков, бросивших играть после первых смертей персонажа в первом же данжоне, и тех, кто давно обосновался в храме с жуками, доступном после первой сотни игровых смертей

Появлению в стиме предшествовали долгие годы разработки силами одного человека, и от версии к версии появлялись новые возможности, новые квесты, новые локации, новые персонажи. Автор утверждает, что финальной версии игры не будет никогда, и я склонен ему верить.

Upd. Если и есть идеальный кандидат на премию "Любимое дитя" в стиме, то это именно он :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197988694307', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1511419502}

author: {'steamid': '76561198012736233', 'num_games_owned': 942, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 758, 'last_played': 1537115294}

author: {'steamid': '76561197980187948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1656183795}
review:
Ok, so this is basically a mother/father of all modern roguelikes (grandmothers being Nethack, e.t.c.), and pretty much everyone into the genre knows what it is, so let's skip the "pros" and get straight to "cons":

* You will die. A lot. And due to all the complexity and random nature of the game, it's not always obvious how you were supposed to avoid that.


In case you're still interested: it is Hardcore with capital H, but I mean it in a best way possible. Also, it's completely remastered with graphical UI and everything, and continues being supported by the dev.



[spoiler] Something out of something, would die choking on my own vomit again. [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198097630491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4177, 'last_played': 1558800369}
review: I first began playing ADOM  many years ago. I was utterly enthralled with it back then and have not gotten over that obsession even today. It is a very deep and challenging game that will test the limits of your gaming abilities. It will leave you scratching your head and wondering how on earth you get to where you need to be. You will die... a lot. ADOM is a role playing game patterned after D&D and combined with a rogue - like gameplay. The graphics are simple, but we'll done, and it will run on even the most modest system. I highly recommend anyone give it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121273308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1641148669}
review: I played a little of ADOM before the resurrection. It's one of the big names that really paved the way for the roguelike genre. ADOM is fairly unique among the other big traditional roguelikes. It's a lot more about story, not satisfied just with fun mechanics under a vague fantasy theme. The presence of the overworld and the interactivity of NPCs offering quests really elevates the RPG elements and immerses the player into the world. Since development was resurrected, the work done has been incredible in taking an already complete experience and modernizing the game, fixing bugs and adding content. The tiles and overall graphics are some of the best among traditional roguelikes (although there are a few menus that still look like an emulated terminal), and the soundtrack is one of my favorites in video games. A lot of work has been put into making the game far more accessible to new players, along with the introduction of more forgiving modes where you can customize the experience or simply play without permadeath.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986895958', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 36516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12413, 'last_played': 1567084543}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969715051', 'num_games_owned': 1238, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1565847994}
review: Played this for many years before supporting it on steam. Great 'single player' oldschool Dungeons and Dragons flavor.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969208726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1356, 'last_played': 1656651766}
review:
This is a fantastic modern version of a legendary rougelike classic. Really digging it. Being an older gamer it takes me back to those halcyon days!

Definitely not for the faint of heart. If you don't know anything about legacy rouge-likes then you might want to watch some Let's Play videos or something first. It might run well on ciurrent hardware (fonts scale great and look smashigly sharp at 4K!) but make no mistake the engine behind it is purge old-school rouge-like. You can even choose to play in ASCII mode and it has all the requisite litany keyboard shortcuts. Though I must say I'm digging the tile art and UI niceties layered over the classic game engine.

If you're going to try it, give it at least 15 hours or so. Play the tutorial. Ease yourself in. You will be killed. You will be killed in glorious and what sometimes feels like unfair ways. Keep learning nuances and information, and keep trudging through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021794395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1510293967}
review: TY steam for scamming me into paying 10€ for this buggy pos wih a UI straight from hell. This should have been like 1€ and labeled early access work in progress. Has this really been in development since 94?? Game could have been somewhat interesting if it werent such an unplayable, buggy mess. Random crashes, horrible controls, crap gameplay, dungeons all seem to have the same senseless layout, story seems to be on par with pacman (Mayor: "go to da western mountains and put a stop to dis chaos thingy" Im not kidding..) Jeez is there no quality control here? Should just stop bying games from steam altogether.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005977733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1538583085}
review: I call this game 'walk through a door and die-game'. Perception high, special skill detect traps, constantly pressing 's' for searching....walk through a door and die - 5, 10, 20 times in a row...

author: {'steamid': '76561197973744884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1516910097}
review:
This is a true roguelike game in that the original itteration of it is, literally, a ground-up variant of rogue.

So don't be surprised if you drink an unlabeled potion and turn into a newt. Or gain a god-like ability. That's just how it goes.

Although I always felt ADOM has a good "rarity" curve on items. You're much more likely to get a cursed helmet of "meh" than a cursed helmet that'll make you a walking target.

Anyway! I've played this game on and off for 15 years and purchased a copy because I never did get around to sending Thomas a postcard. If you're taking the time to read reviews on a roguelike game that now has a nice graphical overlay you'll probably enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062896968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1548843432}
review:
I played ADOM for a little over two hours my first sitting. My first character is dead, but I learned a lot. Don't eat Kobold meat... Feverish fits suck...

I can see this becoming my favorite roguelike I've ever played. It reminds me of playing 2nd Edition AD&D way back when, and I loved every second of my first playthrough.

This review is mainly just a placeholder (and a way to support the devs outside of another purchase) and I'll be updating it in the future once I come to grips with ADOM's systems/gameplay a lot more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273254344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1509170561}
review:
Pros:
-Big game

Cons:
-Developer is extremely unprofessional (look at responses to other negative reviews too)
-Keymapping
-Tedious aspects of the complexity (more below)
-Gets very repetitive very quickly
-Developer actually thinks that repetitiveness refers to character creation, not gameplay
-A little too expensive for what you get
-Can easily screw your character at any time, especially creation
-Magic seems too expensive (in terms of Power Points)
-Developer assumes gender
-Developer ignores parts of reviews he doesn't feel like addressing
-Developer claims he doesn't make any money on a $15 game
-Developer claims anyone who doesn't LOVE his game is a rude, dumb troll

It's one thing to make a game intricate and complex yet fun (think FFT/ToEE).  It's another to add extremely tedious things seemingly to just eat up the player's time without adding fun.  The latter basically sums up ADoM, unfortunately.

Edit: Nominated ADoM for the write in Steam award "Worst Indie Dev"

Congrats!
developer_response:
Ok, it seems that my past comment with actual content was deleted? I didn't even know that you could do that. Which leaves my snarky remark as the only remaining comment from me and shifts the picture more negatively than it IMHO originally appeared.

To repeat the factual points I raised in my now deleted comment:
- It seems that the review does not relate to the most recent release but an older version as many aspects (like tedious keymapping, missing hints and guidance) have been addressed. As we try very hard to improve the game based on feedback I advised the reviewer to once more try out the latest release and see if it felt improved for him.
- I commented on being expensive with the statement that this IMHO is a highly subjective matter. I strongly believe in adding value instead of in engaging in endless discount battles and that's a point to which I stand firmly. I can't feel that the price of a single movie ticket is too expensive for any decent game at all and I believe that ADOM is more than decent enough to be rated at that price level.
- I do not think that ADOM easily screws your character. Examples would be welcome, flat bland statements do not make for a good or helpful review.
- Regarding repetitveness I pointed the review to the various modes in all the latest releases that allow you to create a new character (even with extensive customization) with 3-6 clicks (and a name you need to enter). Which hardly can be called repetitive any more. It takes about 5 seconds to generate a new character if you know what you want to play. Naturally if you check all choices and optimize attributes to the last bit this can take much longer. But that is not necessary to enjoy or win the game and thus a conscious player choice.
- And about me being unprofessional: I'm sorry for reacting with an attitude after you snarked at my initial comments which tried nothing but to explain. I believe I'm taking a lot of time and effort to listen to the player community in general and respond appropriately. What I'm done with after 25 years of doing this is taking people seriously who are rude, dumb, trollish or simply unfactual. Yes, then I'm also leaning towards reacting likewise because I am a human being that spent most of those 25 years doing this for fun in my free time without earning money for it. And I come from a generation where burning down trolls was a good sport. But that doesn't mean you generally will find me unprofessional. I welcome you to discuss this with me face to face at Roguelike Celebration next week in San Francisco if you happen to be around that area (see https://roguelile.club). And I'm happy to offer buying you a meal to soothen any hurt feelings.

Thanks for reading
Thomas Biskup
ADOM Maintainer

author: {'steamid': '76561198098396541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1529729976}

author: {'steamid': '76561198131230522', 'num_games_owned': 585, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 4130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1711249871}
review:
ADOM has rapidly become my favourite of the major roguelikes: it's been discussed many times so I won't add too much to that other than my personal love for this stems mostly from the feel of the game. You can tell any art that has had time, effort and love pumped into it: it radiates out and feels just great. ADOM is exemplary in game design, has a multitude of options and is, for the most part, fair. With any roguelike game, imagination plays a key part (the main reason I still play in ASCII, although I must say that the tiles on this Steam release are of a very high quality indeed and will please those whol prefer graphics) and therefore the feel of a game can be most personal to the player. ADOM has just enough fluff and detail in-game to really allow the imagination to play: you can bump your way through many of the early dungeons without much thought for this and without some of the classic RPG elements this might get a little dull, but I think Thomas Biskup has gotten the mix of ingredients just perfect.

Great great game, worthy of the status as major roguelike, certainly one of the best RPG games ever made and you could do a lot worse than supporting the developers by purchasing the Steam version, as it enables them to add new content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166699775', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 26605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2661, 'last_played': 1649939883}
review: It's an amazing game if you take the time to  learn it.  Just don't go into it expecting you will be able to beat it any time soon, it took me countless hours on the free version to achieve victory.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024929023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 25175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 36, 'playtime_at_review': 23554, 'last_played': 1711271444}
review:
I've played this game for just shy of four hundred hours at the time of writing, and I've only beaten it twice. There are still locations, quests, items, monsters, spells and secrets that I've never encountered, and a large number of race/class combinations I've never tried. Given all that, I've no doubt I'll end up playing four hundred more.

A lot of the negatives mentioned by other reviews are completely accurate. Yes, it's an incredibly hard, punishing game. Yes, the mechanics are complex and hard to understand at first, and the keybindings are extensive and take a lot of time to remember. It'll be a long time before you make significant progress, especially if you want to avoid spoilers, and some deaths will be unfair. It is not balanced, nor does it try to be.

And yet, it's one of the deepest, most compelling and replayable games I've ever come across. If you're up for a challenge and willing to put in some time to learn the game, you will be rewarded manyfold. Ultimately, it's one of the best games I've ever played, and though I wouldn't recommend it for everyone, if you like the idea of a game to invest a substantial amount of time into for relatively cheap, this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049639132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 98005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6297, 'last_played': 1687038901}
review:
I have been playing this game for over 14 years and am proud to see what it has become today.
In my opinion, this is the best Rogue-Like game available. To this day I have never been able to beat it (even when cheating). The sheer randomness of loot drops, monster spawns and traps always keeps me on my toes.

My only complaint Thomas Biskup is that a long time ago... you promised a sequel to this game that would rival the one you already made. Instead you just rebuilt the old one and added new features.
developer_response:
Regarding my ancient promise:

Please have a look at http://www.adom.de/ultimate

We hope to not disappoint you even if it took a while...

author: {'steamid': '76561197970461867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1698889304}

author: {'steamid': '76561198105161247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 10335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1601451390}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116555394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 47055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10722, 'last_played': 1706429996}
review: I first played the original version of ADOM over 10 years ago, and it's still as fun as ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096608094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1504945550}
review: I played a bunch of this game when it was an ASCII-based roguelike, and had a great time with it, though I never got far. This graphical update seems to make the experience worse. The music is unpleasantly mediocre, and sound volume can't be changed in-game. The mouse-based controls are incomplete, meaning you can't play it one-handed (yeah, yeah). I don't like the keyboard-based movement due to the possibility of carpal tunnel syndrome (it's happened to me with other roguelikes) but I also don't like switching back and forth between keyboard and mouse; what the game really needs is an auto-walk feature like in NetHack. This needs a lot more polish, and while it looks like the author is going to put out a major update soon, I'd recommend in the meantime that you just get the ASCII version online and then donate if it really grabs you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041365399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2037, 'last_played': 1484514982}

I've seem reviews complaining about the "fairness" and "difficulty." It is a Roguelike, thats just par for the course.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207089992', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 11242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3033, 'last_played': 1694637853}

author: {'steamid': '76561197963434698', 'num_games_owned': 2678, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 8646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6853, 'last_played': 1609320351}
review:
My favourite roguelike!

You can safely ignore the key binding and "something paralysed" me complaints. The game can be played with mouse alone and enter/esc keys (although it's best using keyboard shortcuts, which you will pick up in time), and from what I can tell by my many foolish, short-sighted, and generally poorly executed expeditions, you're meant to learn by doing/dying - but that's half the fun!

ADOM is incredibly deep. Pun intended - the game is a dungeon crawler after all. I've spent 120 hours and have yet to make it beyond the first area. I'm not much of a Gray Elven Bard, it would seem.

If you love risk and reward at your own pace - get this! There's plenty of loot to be had. Plenty of nail biting moments, and "I'm outnumbered and outarmed, should I drink that unknown potion?" type situations. Plenty of laughs, sweat, swear words, and making it up as you go... She's just a good old fashioned adventure!

Now, if only there was procedural generation of the world map... :-)

Keep up the great work guys! It is sincerely appreciated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063378340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1501995767}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000897377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3228, 'last_played': 1572634537}
review:
This game is rogue-like. Not rogue-lite. This means it takes no pity on your soul. It means that everything may be going ok and the God of RNG will throw an outlier event at you and one-shot your awesome medium level character just because. That is part of the love-hate I have for this game.

I started playing ADOM approx 15 years ago. It was released 21 years ago on DOS. It is fair to say that this game has replay value and longevity.

With the Steam launch and the NotEye graphics version I find this game to be more approachable as the game provides easier visual clues as to what sort of monsters/items are shown on screen instead of having to remember what is a pink left parenthesis and what is a green at sign.

Overall my score for this game is 4/5 -- I take one away for all the damned one-shots Biskup has reigned down my up-n-coming heros.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037325020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 17053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11936, 'last_played': 1548464721}
review:
10/10 would stumble through half of the wilderness of the Drakalor Chain blinded by mud not realizing I just have to wipe my 'F'ace again.

With more seriousness though, if you're here reading this, I assume you know what a rogue-like (as opposed to a rogue-lite) is, and what that means in terms of a high learning curve and general gameplay difficulty.
I constantly read the Ancardia Wiki (that's the only way I learned about shift+'f'), and I constantly get my rear-end sliced off and handed to me on a plate. Sometimes I forget I have a healing spell or have a wand, sometimes I just die in an early dungeon to falling rocks or fireball traps, and sometimes I make decent progress, let it go to my head and then get in over my head, and get swarmed by things I can't kill. But I keep coming back for more, because that's the kind of masochist I am.

*spoilers*
Someday, I will make it past level 20 before I get into a situation where I'm in over my head.
Someday after that, I will get really lucky and save Khelevaster, but still die in combat a couple floors down when I had an unidentified wand that would have saved my life.
Someday far in the future, I will be a couple steps from godhood, able to put all of ChAoS at my mercy... and then die once again to random rocks falling from the ceiling because I'm low hp from the aftermath.
And perhaps someday, years down the line, I will beat this game. I will sigh, and slump down into a heap... and play again because I still will have only gotten a normal ending.

Because that's the kind of noob and masochist I am, and that's the kind of game this is.
10/10 would die a million times for a one chance at glory again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007125697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2212, 'last_played': 1668107270}
review:
I played a lot of ADOM at the beginning of this millennium but stopped playing 10 years ago or so. I bought the game after some consideration and have to say that I do not regret that. The game is still the same old ADOM, but there is also lot of additions made.

I was also very sceptical about the GUI as my experience related to that in rogue likes have been negative.  So I usually prefer ASCII graphics. But I found no issues with the ADOM GUI and it kind of brings the whole new level to the game. I find the monster graphics to be well considered since I often guess the monster without even checking it. 

I'm not fan of whole achievement idea in games generally, because I find them worthless and boring to grind. But this game already had agreed achievements back then like eternium man and such, which you can now achieve officially. Definitely going to try to finish some of the most challenging ones after I finish game few times  :)

For new players the ADOM must be a hard game to get into, but it has so much reply value and depth. Usually every death teaches you something new, so don't give up. Also read game tips and Google things.

Ups and down:

+Game depth
+Replay value
+Challenges
+Every class play style is very different
+Best GUI I have seen in rogue likes

-merciless learning curve
-middle game is partially repetitive

author: {'steamid': '76561197988075335', 'num_games_owned': 1911, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1537554546}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116818974', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1558268840}
review:
Llevo enganchado a este roguelike desde que comencé a jugar en el Amiga. Salió en el 94-95, así que igual hace más de 20 años de mi primera partida.

Si os van los roguelikes, este es bueno. Creo que es más accesible que el NetHack y, aunque nunca he estado ni remotamente cerca de acabármelo, tiene variedad a raudales y todos los ingredientes clásicos de los roguelikes.

Tiene un modo gráfico muy bonito, pero por supuesto, tenéis que jugar en modo ascii...

author: {'steamid': '76561198052373608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1496504727}
review:
A bit of patience is really an understatement. Half the keybindings don't seem to work, the tutorial tells you to do things that you can't (I'm supposed to press 'z' to zap something, but I don't have any wands, except a rod which apparently doesn't count or doesn't appear - I don't understand it yet).

I've also been told at several points that I'm supposed to be able to change something by pressing things like Ctrl + Alt + m or Ctrl + nm. Commands like this never seem to work. None of the menus make much intuitive sense either, and the whole thing just seems like a huge pain to learn.

If you really enjoy Vim and, while playing other video games, find yourself wondering 'Why can't this be more like Vim?', then go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130988011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1679708013}
review:
TLDR: Very challanging, totally worth it.

Without a doubt one of my all time favorite games. I have been playing since 97 when a friend gave it to me on a floppy disc. In no time I was hooked and have been playing since. There is a lot to learn, and the game does not apologize for it's difficulty in any way, but if you like real rogue likes this should be nothing new to you.

On that note, this is a real rogue like game. Much cleaner and better built than Nethack or it's close relatives (Slash/Slash'EM) in my opinion. Well worth the $15 and over coming the learning curve. Typical of rogue like games the learning curve here is a bit steep, but I found it rather enjoyable as well.

It is completely possible to play this game "unspoiled". Everything you need to know to win the game is in the game. NPCs can give you hints, or my favorite is to eat fortune cookies and learn a little something about the game from the message inside. No need to go to the internet to learn the things you need to know, which is a common problem with games of this depth these days. If you want to read ahead and learn from other's experience the communty has documented a ton of stuff to help you understand all the little corners of this game.

Buy the game. Challange yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960476483', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 19273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1782, 'last_played': 1704060016}
review: Nice game for Rogue Lovers

author: {'steamid': '76561198000950474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 13083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5618, 'last_played': 1639225871}
review:
If you want a game of depth, challenge and are not bothered by graphics, this is fantastic. One of the top three all-time roguelikes, beating this in any form is an incredible achievement.

Completions: About 9, but only 1 post-Steam purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368537502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 195948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 433, 'playtime_at_review': 17828, 'last_played': 1712384111}
review:
One of the greatest games of all time. It is a  bit like running a nuclear power plant, but that suits some people. :)

Progress is so hard and death is always near, but walking that thin line, and using your wits to prepare and survive the toughest situations is incredibly satisfying.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979055261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 252, 'playtime_forever': 979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1697816521}
review: One of the best true rougelike games available. Chalenging as hell, but you die & learn each time. Tons of items, spells, monsters, races, and classes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198251858654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1493203189}
review:
I first saw ADOM back in 2002, when I was introduced to Rogue-like-games by thinking NetHack was a game about hacking the internet.

This more modern version of the game with Sprites and pictures is nice, it is also nice I still need to use the keyboard to play and it is turned based so I can stop at any time go make a coffee or go to work for a few hours then return to my game.

ADOM is a classic I think everybody should spend a few hours playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087451719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2366, 'last_played': 1656188187}
review:
ADOM has taken my appreciation of good roguelikes and shown me how much deeper that enjoyment can go. This one gets so many things right without leaving me wanting much else. It is highly replayable, challenging, and has created some awesome stories that evolve every time I play. It really is incredible. I have mostly played in ASCII but have recently been using the tiles, and I am quite loving the art style. Switching between both styles is simple (F10), too, so that is a plus.

tl;dr: buy this if you want to play a piece of roguelike history



p.s.: thank you Gordon Overkill for having so many great gameplay videos, as that helped me make the purchase :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197992221936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 30620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1605736331}
review: других рогаликов нет.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090002778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 16124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4265, 'last_played': 1540329934}
review: ADOM causes me to not sleep enough. It is an incredible game and I remember cracking out on it way back in the 1990s. So happy to have found this on Steam. Thomas Biskup was long overdue for some compensation for the development of this classic from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986637486', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1451778890}
review:
Play it for an hour, play it for days, months, years - you won't get bored.
One of THE classic rogue like dungeon crawlers, if you haven't played it yet you missed a part of gaming history.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011734844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 30608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7698, 'last_played': 1574904541}
review: Amazing game. Together with TOME4, DCSS and Sword of the Stars the Pit, this is one of the 4 best rogue-likes ever made, in my opinion. And I've played tons od rogue-likes over the year, since it is one of my favorite genres.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049776088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 12243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7088, 'last_played': 1490822851}
review:
Extraordinary game.

This game started as an ASCII roguelike and pretty small, now it is graphical and but not pretty big. It's colossal.

First of all before you start the game you have to understand that the game has kind of a learning curve, there will be a lot of deaths caused by things you did not expect. If you especially hate starting over, the game is not for you. I hate starting over too but not enough to deter me from this masterpiece. There are so many race/class combinations to give you a new kind of game that you are mostly just excited to try again with different tools - if your high elf wizard died early to some trivial door trap, start over with a troll beastfighter. Now you maybe cannot read but hey, the trap that killed the flimsy elf only tickles you. Maybe use those spellbooks you find as missiles now? And if you die again perhaps try a more stealthy approach as a gnomish assassin. You get the idea. 

The monster library is endless and the game story is intriguing, I dunno how anyone can have the intelligence and creativity required to make this game happen but I am glad someone did. It's a very complex and unforgiving RPG - to be able to beat the game honestly you will need a lot of time, brains, patience, nerves and also some luck. ADOM is _not for everyone_ but I still recommend if you like RPG's and a BIG challenge. TIP> use the internet for information, there is a good wiki. EXTRA TIP> to make the most out of the game, disable all form of game saving and go for the true ADOM experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073648775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1497464760}
review:
This is not a review. I am just letting people know to disregard any negative reviews concerning keyboard commands and key bindings.  I just played a bit and used my mouse for the entire session.  There are many key commands if you just want to use a keyboard, but ALL of the keyboard commands are listed right next to the written commands.  You do not have to memorize tons of keyboard commands to play ADOM. There's even floating text windows that appear when you mouse over certain things.

ADOM is now streamlined and very user friendly!  I almost didn't purchase this game because of the negative reviews concerning the multitude of keyboard commands. So if you were on the fence about purchasing this game but was worried about having to memorize many keyboard command, it's not true any longer.  You can use your mouse for "most" of the commands.  I never needed to use the keyboard once...

Just by my brief session with the game, I can assure you that this is a quality game made with a lot of love!  There are many options covering all aspects of the game.  The UI is basic, but again has many options and is also mouse driven.  This game has been steamlined and looks to be one of the best roguelikes I have played.  So far I would recommend this game, but I have not played it long enough to really review it.  

So far the game has runs silky smooth on my computer, but crashed when I quit the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023916808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 18295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7315, 'last_played': 1562097682}
review: Absolutely the best RPG game of all times. There is no other which I still play (when time allows) since 1998 or so...

author: {'steamid': '76561198365364026', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4196, 'last_played': 1607718401}
review:
Play ADOM over 20 years. that's all you must know about it.
Играю в ADOM больше 20 лет. это все, что ты должен знать.

Очень жду Ultimate ADOM. Мы все ждем.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015739061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1554171719}
review:
Let me be clear, this game is exactly the same as the origional roguelike. It does require a bit of patience, but includes mouse support. That simple interface upgrade along with actual graphics makes this game more than worth the 15 dollars. Adom is easily in the conversation for one of the best rpg's created, and was easily 10 years ahead of its time. If you played Adom, you owe this man 15 bucks for his amazing free game. Not to mention. You get to re-live this groundbreaking rpg.

If you are into extremely difficult rpg's and can tolorate a dnd like learning curve this is the game for you. It can be unforgiving but us well worth the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990224915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1574665750}
review: Honestly don't know if this game is good or bad.  Played about 8 minutes just trying to do something about the keybindings because I don't have a numpad.  Come to find out, I just wasted my money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002637622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 35501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6676, 'last_played': 1624721077}
review: I've been playing this game for over a decade and it's still my favorite. I always joke when I build a new gaming PC that I'm making a $1200 ADOM Box. Most complex, replayable game ever. The corruption system makes for the most perfect difficulty curve ever made in a game. I sympathize those that say this game is too complex, and it's not for everyone. I hate to sound like an old man but kids today don't have the patience for a game like this. That's ok though, it's their loss. Give it a try, and someday you may experience what I felt when you finally beat this monster (it took me 4 years). No game has given me a better feeling of accomplishment.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998033010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1487898259}
review: Too complex for my tastes and for what it is actually...pass!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025552642', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 5107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2073, 'last_played': 1645072208}
review:
ADOM is a fantastic game. Only reason it doesn't show many hours played it becuse of the countless hours I played it before it came to Steam. I'm talking YEARS here. If you like standard fantasy role-playing, if you like keeping track of minute stats, if you like a turn-based game, if you like a crazy amount of creativity - you will enjoy playing this game. I've played the ASCii version so much, that I've dreamt of little ts, big Ps and countless little ws attacking me while I slept. This game has so much to offer, so many puzzles to play and the it's NEVER the same game twice. 

Plus, when this game started out, the only thing the guy requested in return was a postcard  - how cool is that?!?

If you want to support a little indie game, that is a stat-fest, dungeon-crawl, with about 20 different playable character options - buy this game. Trust me - every single penny will be worth it - EVEN at full price (it's THAT good).

author: {'steamid': '76561198076585651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1487867606}
review: And I thought it was anything like TOME. This just makes me annoyed. So many things should just be easier to handle in the game. Key binds etc. meh im back to tome

author: {'steamid': '76561198045882856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 2532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2103, 'last_played': 1508179289}
review:
Yep, it's a good one. Works no problem in Linux and goes full screen on living room widescreen. You can customize the graphic tile size so it's easy to see.

True rogue like. Die a lot. One dungeon started out with a Lich King right at the stairs to dungeon. I could have evacuated but I thought hmm maybe this is some kind of wimpy Lich King. Nope, another dead character.

Like many others, I will probably play this off and on for years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013412470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3829, 'last_played': 1573401482}
review:
Думаю пора, настал момент написать об этой игре!

Впервые я сыграл в нее в 2001 году. Фактически, благодаря этой игре я получил первые знания английского языка. Я просто сидел со словариком и запоминал значение слов. Конечно, играть я ее стал не из-за желания по-упражняться в владении английским языком, а из-за вариантивности.

Фактически, тебе предлагается огромный мир. Ты можешь пойти сразу бороться с Хаосом и как можно быстрее закончить игру, можешь стать сам богом Хаоса. А можешь просто «покачаться» и покинуть этот богом проклятый мир (в прямом смысле слова!).

Но что еще меня заинтересовало... сложность! Черт побери, это самая сложная игра, в которую я играл. У тебя просто нет права на ошибку. Увидел молоха или кармического дракона? Ищи в своем рюкзаке что тебе может помочь. Не нашел? БЕГИ!

Огромное разнообразие рас и персонажей. Огромное количество монстров. Одно не радует, квестов довольно мало и практически все они являются сюжетными. Нет, это не плохо и не хорошо, но можно было бы и при перезапуске добавить гораздо больше квестов.

Тем, кто любит RPG, фентези жанр и игры, в которые трудно пройти с первого раза - советую. Оно того стоит. Знания английского достаточно на уровне Elementary. С механикой игры можно ознакомится в игровой вики.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057339247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1572752132}
review:
this game is super cool 
i remember playing the free ASCII version late at night all the time with Soft Cell's Greatest Hits album playing. this version has updated graphics and has its own music which is pretty good too. i still prefer listening to Soft Cell while playing though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971580755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 23511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6468, 'last_played': 1588356352}
review: One of the most well polished Roguelike games out there with a nice user interface. I keep coming back to this one over all others despite never beating it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122574382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1486019541}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005894566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1626029543}
review:
Me and ADOM go back. I love this game, and if you love roguelikes you will too. ADOM has lots of strategy and variety to it. Personally I don't care if my review convinces you to buy the game or not. Just read and learn what you can befor making that decison. Permadeath and hunger you can switch off but for me it's a very fun part of the game. So if permadeath isn't your thing you can still enjoy this. 

  My only thing is I wish we had more heads to chose from for each race. Every human female will look the same, every grey elf male etc. But coming from when this game was ascii I'm fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085770413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1653, 'last_played': 1517963159}
review:
A masterpiece.

I've been playing this game for over 15 years now, its the only game that keeps me coming back with the infinite variety of gameplay and difficulty. When you play this game you need to always keep your wits about, and when death is around every corner you become invested in your characters. I have had some majestic achievments in this game, as well as tragic downfalls all too many times. I only play on ASCII as that's what I'm used to. It takes a long time to truly master and appreciate everything you can do in the game, and I've never encountered another game anywhere with such a level of variety in playstyles. As others have said, if I could only play one game for the rest of my life, it would be this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073578301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 2569, 'last_played': 1712100440}
review: First time i played ADOM like a 10 year ago, so i not very interested in new graphic style, but ADOM still a nice game. If you love true old rpg, this game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972065620', 'num_games_owned': 2054, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1710013794}
review:
This is a game I have been playing on and off in its free form since around 2001. It surely deserves a place next to Dwarf Fortress as a legendary hardcore roguelike, with so many combinations of possibilities and available content. If you like your games complex and with a lot of mechanics that are difficult to master, then try this game. It is available in a free format in pure ASCII from www.adom.de, but this Steam verison is much nicer to play, and definitely worth the few quid it costs in terms of the amount of replayability.

Definitely a game you can play again and again and find something new each time. It might well be one of my 'desert island' games for this reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333010227', 'num_games_owned': 565, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1854, 'last_played': 1680426322}
review:
For those of you who don't know. ADOM is (originally) an extremely hard, ascii based rouge-like which has been around on multiple formats since the late 90's. Personally I think it's by far the best traditional rogue-like, and I've tried a few over the years.

Is it worth paying fifteen bucks to play a game you can get for free without the graphics/sound? Hell yeah! The only thing I can think of which is wrong with it is the text can be a bit small, but then the display has more lines, so it evens out I guess.

Even with what would easily be over five hundred hours playing this game over the last 15+ years or so, first on Amiga, then on Windows. I've only ever completed this game once, and even then I was cheating by backing up my save file. Something which is uneccesary in this Steam version, as there is the option to disable perma-death in exchange for a big reduction in points. There are also options to selct optimal birth month, stat rolls, etc. Which saves a LOT of time if you play ADOM as I do with a specific charachter class in mind.

The graphics and sounds actually add quite a bit to the gameplay.  Especially the sound which allows you to hear if you've hit or missed or been hit. And graphics for example; It's much easier to locate the tiny girl in Terinyo when you can see a graphic of a tiny girl instead of a red "t" which under the Windows version could look almost identical to an orange "t" on some monitors.

For those who are unfamiliar with ADOM, even if familiar with other rogue-likes such as Angband, the keyboard configuration will seem a bit alien. But the list of keybindings is readily available in-game by pressing "?" as well as on the title screen, so it shouldn't take too long to get comfortable. For those familiar with ADOM, you'll be pleased to know that it's exactly the same.

Oh, and I don't know if I'm just being distracted by the beautiful hand-pixelled graphics and atmospheric music, but it seems to be just a little bit harder that the text-based ADOM, especially the small mountain cave. Getting a character over level ten can be an achivement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120841934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 37923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19204, 'last_played': 1705234600}
review:
ADOM is not for the faint of heart: you will die. But if you embrace the roguelike mindset you will find a game so full of discovery you will be astonished. I still remember the feeling I had after my first win of the game roughly 10 years ago. I personally love the new tileset, even if it took some getting used to. Performance issues have been fixed in the latest patch, and everything runs smoothly now. One thing I especially love is the sound effetcs, which add quite a bit of immersion to the game.

ADOM has entertained me for roughly 15 years, and it will entertain me for 15 more. If you can only buy 1 game for the rest of your life buy ADOM.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981624277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 311, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1480896625}
review:
It's a fun roguelike but it's a hardcore one and I'm not recommending it based on that.

Because anyone familiar with it will pick it up. However it deceptively has adopted a great looking interface and graphics. Unfortunately this game is riddled with redundant commands from the 90's.

A new set of graphics and mouse support are completely redundant if the core game will still play by utilising your entire keyboard including ALT, CTRL, and Capital and non capital letters. It is ridiculous to try and revive and modernise it without addressing those core issues.
For that reason I cannot recommend it. If however people want a modernised rogue-like game, they can look at things like Tales of Maj'E

author: {'steamid': '76561197995198838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 996, 'last_played': 1537927598}
review:
In addition to everything one would expect from an isometric dungeon crawler:
- randomly generated dungeons
- dozens of character build combinations
- thousands of unique items
- hundreds of unique monsters
This expansive roguelike brings a great many welcome innovations to the genre, like:
- difficulty sliders, to give you precise control over the level of challenge you face. Options such as hunger, permadeath, and treasure drop rates allow you to toggle between a grueling challenge and lightweight game.
- a plot! And it's actually quite good!
- multiple possible endings!
- expansive set piece battles!
- complex puzzles!
- being developed consistently for years!
- global and local high score boards that rank your scores based on your progress and difficulty!

Everything about this game is brilliant, and it just keeps getting better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003570291', 'num_games_owned': 869, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 9810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9540, 'last_played': 1456286248}
review: The roguelike that first got me into the genre a decade ago, still just as good as when I first played it. It's fun everytime, no matter how long it has been since I last played. If you like difficult and punishing games give this one a try. You will die. You will die a lot, but you'll have fun doing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986929691', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1648115023}
review: Śledzę losy tej gry i wracam do niej od czasu do czasu od 20 lat. Best game ever!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028564411', 'num_games_owned': 1160, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 16780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15166, 'last_played': 1481763105}
review:
ADOM should be named YASD: Yet Another Stupid Death... I know that, because I play ADOM for about 12 years*) already and never was even close to beat it.

11/10 Would die again

... and again


*) 13 years already, still not even close.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997805615', 'num_games_owned': 1681, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 24187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11229, 'last_played': 1665942365}
review:
최고의 로그라이크
얼티밋 버전이 나온다고 한다

author: {'steamid': '76561197975047891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 22380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7257, 'last_played': 1709163808}

I haven't played the graphical version properly yet, but a few quick tries are very promising!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985208702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1641598699}
review: A deep and very fun roguelike!

author: {'steamid': '76561198237300450', 'num_games_owned': 1027, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 809, 'last_played': 1698935205}
review:
Quem não se importa com graficos e tem interesse em sofrer um pouco até se acostumar com a jogabilidade, ADOM é um jogo EXCELENTE com uma jogabilidade simples, mas complicada, e muito dificil (para morrer de forma besta e perder horas de jogo com aquele personagem é facinho).

Se for comprar tem que se estar preparado para , pois a jogabilidade dele é MUITO diferente dos outros jogos atuais desse genero. Como o jogo a principio foi criado para se jogar em MS-DOS ele tem muitos comandos (por ser uma limitação daquela época), quase todas letras e numeros do teclado tem um comando configurado para ela, tem também diferença entre maiúsculo e minúsculo até se acostumar demora um pouco.

Como os jogos atuais tem graficos incriveis em relação a como o ADOM era a principio, colocaram um versão gráfica para  conseguir ter um imerção melhor ao jogo pelo fato de ter algo que você ja consegue visualizar rapidamente sem ter que ficar imaginando como seria o mundo e personagens. Diferente de antigamente que era totalmente em caracteres ASCII com diferentes cores nos caracteres para sinalizar o que era cada coisas seja ela cenário, NPC, monstros ou itens. Então tenha uma mente mais aberta para 

PS: para quem não quiser comprar ADOM o criador disponibiliza uma versão free no site do jogo, só que está versão tem bastante recursos a menos que a versão paga, mas nada que impossibilite de jogar

author: {'steamid': '76561198025780750', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 24834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7216, 'last_played': 1659428167}
review:
아이템 파괴에 미친 게임이다.

화염 공격은 'Blessed' ring of ice로 장비한 아이템을 95% 확률로 방어 가능
인벤에 있는 템은 'Blessed' fireproof blanket으로 90% 방어 가능

얼음 공격은 'Blessed' ring of fire로 장비한 아이템을 거의 100% 확률로 방어 가능 (냉기에 취약한 방어구가 없음)
포션은 아티팩트 potion belt가 없으면 낮은 확률로 터짐

물 공격은 함정이건 브레스건 'Blessed' waterproof blanket이 없다면 높은 확률로 스크롤이 찢어짐
방어구는 뭐든 좋으니 망토만 잘 끼고있으면 막힘.

전기 공격은 이 미친 겜이 후반에 전격 브레스만 뿜어대는 블루 드래곤을 떼거지로 깔아놓고는 아이템에 대한 방어 수단이 전혀 없음.
철제, 가죽, 천은 그냥 다 터졌다고 보면 되고, 인벤에 있는건 그냥 매턴 두세개씩 터진다고 보면 됨. Air Temple 입구에 템 안 버리고 진입하면 쌍욕이 절로 나올것.

산성은 가장 자비가 없는 속성인데, 이 게임에서 몽크 제외하곤 항상 끼고다녀야할 세븐 리그 부츠를 심심하면 깨먹는 악랄한 속성이기때문. 브레스나 에시드 볼같은 속성으로 쳐맞으면 인벤 내에 있는게 가끔 깨지는건 그러려니한데, 산성 웅덩이 함정을 밟으면 신발부터 쪼개짐.


자비라곤 한 줌도 존재하지 않는 악마 새끼가 만든게 분명.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096709715', 'num_games_owned': 5042, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1480236480}
review:
Kann dieses Spiel nur allen Roguelike-Fans empfehlen. Ja, man stirbt schnell, ja, in die Steuerung und die Spielmechanik muss man ein wenig länger reinfinden als "Guck mal, da sind die Pfeiltasten". Aber das ist ja auch so gewollt, ein Roguelike eben.

Was speziell ADOM ausmacht, ist die unermüdliche Zähigkeit, die nicht nur die Spieler, sondern auch der Autor aufbringt. Das letzte Mal, dass ich ADOM vor dem Steam-Release gespielt habe, war irgendwann Mitte 90er, seitdem wurde unermüdlich an dem Spiel gearbeitet. Die überwältigende Spieltiefe gab es schon lange, aber die Grafik und viele Details wurden überarbeitet. Die jetzige Version finde ich sehr gut gelungen und auch Neueinsteiger finden gut ins Spiel.

Wer das Spiel erstmal ausprobieren will, kann mit ADOM Classic auch die kostenlose Version von der ADOM-Webseite spielen und sich dann nochmal entscheiden. Der Preis für die Steam-Version ist zumindest aus meiner Sicht angemessen, denn ich habe viel Zeit mit ADOM verbracht und konnte mit dem Kauf jetzt etwas zurückgeben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030810781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 53879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27629, 'last_played': 1620105353}
review:
I've put over 500 hours into this game and still never beaten it. 

Maybe next time....

author: {'steamid': '76561198041504541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5889, 'last_played': 1457221516}
review:
Not for the easily frustrated. You're going to die. It's only a matter of when, and how. You'll learn to fear big numbers, because no matter how many levels you earn, your chance of death remains the same.

The challenge mode is a fun change of pace, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996369902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1587565876}
review: One of the best rogue-like game ever. There is nothin to say anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005294968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1616176648}
review:
I have played ADOM for over 20 years. It still captivates and infuriates me in equal measure.
The new version, with graphics and mouse support is fantastic. After getting used to the new controls, I can now appreciate the beauty of the artwork, and the deep gameplay.

The new quests, boss monsters and other additions simply make the game even more re-playable.

Pros:
Awesome character classes that play very differently
Deep gameplay but not too much padding
Huge number of monsters, items and features to find
Quests which mean something
Many different playstyles accommodated.

Cons:
Controls are awkward
Sometimes the RNG Gods seem particularly vindictive
The opening areas can get a bit repetitive after multiple deaths.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007716952', 'num_games_owned': 445, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1756, 'last_played': 1577380269}
review:
Been playing it since 1999. I think I was close to winning once. Somewhere around 2013. My elven sorceress choked on her vomit in an unremarkable dungeon.

22/11/2018: Still playing, still choking, still dying. Actually, I think the world of Ancardia might be in danger.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004171087', 'num_games_owned': 792, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 19580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4711, 'last_played': 1679831629}
review:
One of the oldest (and best) roguelikes out there. Updated graphics, effects, and UI from the old postcard-ware versions. Ongoing development.

Epic quest, multiple endings. High chance of death. Proceedurally generated dungeons with a fixed overworld map.
Extensive equipment and artifact list. 

Best and deepest roguelike you will play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057213932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4735, 'last_played': 1453816033}
review: Ah old, old roguelike game that I was familiar with from when it still was pure ASCII pseudographics. Rather deep story, many ways to achieve different endings, a lot of things to explore, innumerable little tricks and non-obvious things one can use to play the game. All in all, a very good game with almost infinite replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086721268', 'num_games_owned': 962, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 9189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2499, 'last_played': 1710014436}
review:
I have played ADoM for more than fifteen years (so far). The game is amazing, the community is helpful and welcoming, and the passion of the development team keeps this game not just alive but constantly improving. The post-Indiegogo updates have added and refined much to an already content-stuffed and hyper-polished game. ADoM is still the best roguelike by far, and getting better with every release.

Favorite death: When I was sacrificed by an orc and learned that the gods find the *player* an acceptable burnt offering.

2024 Update: ADoM is now feature-complete and had its last bugfix update in 2020. UADoM: Caverns of Chaos appears to have been abandoned (prosaic business/money reasons), so ironically [i]*this*[/i] is the ultimate version of ADoM. The free version (at adom.de) [b]is[/b] the full game, but paid ADoM is well worth the money for its extra gamemodes, gameplay customization options, and Steam/GOG integration.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979998515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2285, 'last_played': 1686451289}
review: ADOM is a decent roguelike dungeon crawler with lots of character class/race customization. Lots of choices, lots of ways to win, and even more to die. You can be a troll fighter and eat whoever you kill, but still die because a snake bit you, and you can't read so you don't know a cure poison spell. You can die because you accidentally cast a fire spell in a room full of infinate angry trees and, try as you might, you can only take down 751 of them before you run out of healing spells and mana potions. You can die because you ate a puppy. It's a good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983593411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 39405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8686, 'last_played': 1610226797}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014795458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1652716857}
review: Эту игру можно взять с собой на необитаемый остров

author: {'steamid': '76561198029866766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1677885654}
review:
This game is easily the one I spend most time on in my entire gaming life, probably months worth of play. I started to play it some 14 years ago, played occasionally since then and I'm returning to it now. It is still that good, or even better with the recent enhancements. It's great it made it to Steam! I shines in its category (roguelike). The complexity of it's mechanics is unparallelled and it is probably the single feature that makes it so playable. It even has a particular command 'Clean ears' which makes sense only once in the game, and helps to save your life. Find for yourself how to use it :)
It is hard. You will die a lot. You will restart. You will explore, discover the mechanics of the world by experimenting on your own body with potions, food and desperately looking for some corpse to eat not to starve to death. You will struggle with your fate, avoid doom, haggle with your deity, swim, launch fireballs, avoid killing cats, hunt for black dragons in the wilderness with a dragon-slying arrows, fly from monsters that could smash you with one blow, return and scortch them with a single spell bouncing off the walls. You can fight a god,  become a god, and many many more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999465262', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3318, 'last_played': 1657720707}
review: Dont let my hours fool you. I have probably logged over 3000 hours in this game, and have been playing it for over a decade and will pick it up for a full month at a time when i get the urge. Great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041528543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 22312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15943, 'last_played': 1557339342}
review: I have played this 10+ years. Still love it. Took me 10 years to beat the game, that's how hard it can be. I highly recommend it if you like roguelikes and enjoy challenging games. Plus they are still updating adom, so fun never ends.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973008282', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5694, 'last_played': 1710008482}

author: {'steamid': '76561198064256595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 37564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21424, 'last_played': 1706013142}

666/5 stars

author: {'steamid': '76561198000066842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7318, 'last_played': 1461287803}
review: Mercilessly difficult but extremely satisfying.  Every death is a learning experience with persistence eventually leading to victory.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097666642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 23616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1820, 'last_played': 1710144514}
review: первый и оставшийся единственным вечный рогалик, постоянно кочующий из системы в систему.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992142701', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 19270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11129, 'last_played': 1616017062}
review: I've been playing this game for about 10 years on and off now, and for me, this game is unique in it's ability to surprise and challenge me again and again. Every time I roll a new character I am faced with new challenges, and learn new things through the errors I make. The learning curve is extremely steep, and the game is dreadful to start with, but once you get the hang of it, it will keep on challenging you. Plus, you can strangle steel golems with your bare hands. That counts for something right?

author: {'steamid': '76561197962123748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1232, 'last_played': 1702642646}
review: This isn't "just" a Roguelike. This is what happens when a Roguelike is injected with narration and challenges, and real goals and a vibrant world to explore. And if you really can't get over yourself, you also have a typical endless dungeon to play. So, shut up AND JOIN THE ADOM!

author: {'steamid': '76561198108011240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6331, 'last_played': 1511052276}
review:
I played this game so much a long, long time ago that when it appeared on steam i decided to buy it just to have it on my computer again and give the devs some well deserved money. To my biggest surprise I still  enjoy playing it. 
There is an incredible variety of characters you can play (races + classes + traits), huge number of items to be found and monsters to fight, all this coupled with RNG make every run a different one. 
I could say it has good replayability....except for the fact that within all these years I was only be able to beat it once... so be warned, the game is exteremely challenging and you will die a lot. And then start again. And again. And again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003794838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 18126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11914, 'last_played': 1708624391}
review:
One of the best rogues easily. Really wide with options and million ways of dieing by own stupidity. Rewarding to learn from own mistakes and finally beat the game.

Still kicking

author: {'steamid': '76561198027625757', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2381, 'last_played': 1672946227}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991353733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5365, 'last_played': 1620471463}
review: Honestly this game just keeps surprising me, ive never felt such depth since dwarf fortress

author: {'steamid': '76561197993233598', 'num_games_owned': 2959, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 63301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3066, 'last_played': 1668115710}
review:
One of the best Roguelikes of all time, alongside other greats such as Nethack, Tales of Maj'Eyal and Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup.

ADoM has a massive amount of depth and complexity, yet is still very easy to get into. It's not hard to pick up the basics, but mastery is another matter. You'll quickly learn how to survive, and more importantly learn what will pretty much guarantee a painful death.

A well detailed world to explore. A massive number of items to play with. A staggering number of enemy types. A great deal of quests. And a hell of a lot of challenge make ADoM one of the finest Roguelike experiences available.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030880843', 'num_games_owned': 2496, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 6947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6492, 'last_played': 1529744896}
review: The best rogue-like for me. I admit, it's because I was mesmerized to this when I was a teenager.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005798566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 6362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1472, 'last_played': 1609501192}
review: Fun little game, can be frustrating at times when you get killed by a low level critter due to being almost dead from a bigger nasty but I keep coming back and seeing how long it takes me to die each time :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198074378373', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3323, 'last_played': 1684613626}
review:
The return of the rogue-like classic, an absolute must to have.

If you didn't play old ADOM, try it now, with pleasant graphics and improved balance.
If you did, get it to revisit the days of your youth. Still as mesmerizing as ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014846255', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2956, 'last_played': 1628317693}
review:
Note:  This is to satisfy the requirements for The Steam Awards

Over the decade that I´ve first played this game, there have been a number of times I should of been doing something productive instead of exploring some long-lost dungeon, cave, or lair.  Manyatime have been spent trying not to get hit by my own Bolt spell, dodging a creature´s attack or just dying due to not being able to find something to eat.

One of the best rouge-like games. Plays on Linux very well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006487088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1479966898}
review: I've been playing this game off and on for 20 years.  When I discovered that the author had created this Steam version, I happily threw down my $15.  It was a small price to pay for the entertainment this game has given me.  The new graphics, soundtrack, and new options have made this gem new again, and I look forward to playing it for years to come.  I highly recommend this game to those who are fans of roguelikes and have a soft spot for the days of ASCII graphics.  10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197971403647', 'num_games_owned': 4803, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 41918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5757, 'last_played': 1680912950}
review:
31 august 2021 update: 
after playing ultimate adom for some time since the 1.0 update, i find myself coming back to the original ADOM ... 

maybe i will give ultimate adom a try again some time in the future after more updates.

the original ADOM is still the best for me !!!


==========================================================

This review is to satisfy the
"Review or update your review of a game you nominated" 
for the 
"Steam Awards Nomination Committee 2016" badge

Also, I voted this for
THE "TEST OF TIME" AWARD

And yes, I recommend this game, but only if you have the patience for hardcore rogue-like games.

Otherwise, you could always save scum like I do. 

ADOM save file folder location: 
My Documents\ADOM\adom_steam\savedg

Then you can create a .bat file for the save file backups. 

Create a folder called "backup" 

Then create a backup.bat file

backup.bat
echo off
copy yourcharactername.svg backup

then a restore.bat file

restore.bat
echo off
delete yourcharactername..svg
copy backup\yourcharactername..svg

Then you can enjoy ADOM with a character save backup. 

However, if you do beat the game, the system will still know how many times you have died and came back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100913899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1658, 'last_played': 1649381708}
review:
I've been playing this for more than ten years and I keep coming back. I don't recommend using NotEye, i didn't like it much, the raw game is very enjoyable on its own.

If you love games that are almost infinitely difficult and complex this is for you. Take my word if you spend the time to learn how to fully play this game it will be something you play off and on for the rest of your *unnatural life..

author: {'steamid': '76561197993265326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1560239626}
